content: One of the best note taking apps out there! There is a plethora, almost confusing array of settings making this absolutely top notch for University lecturers like me. Interface is a bit technical, and menu options not really well named or organized, but after all its from the Linux world, so its for computer-smart people.

If you have an android-based device this is by far the best, deepest and most feature-filled note taking app for those of us who prefer to "write" notes, not just type them. Unfortunately, I moved to an intel-based chromebook as my primary device recently, and this app is unusable on that platform. I hope Lecture Notes gets optimized for Chromebooks soon. I miss this app, terribly. OneNote and Google Keep are empty pretenders when it comes to handwritten notes. But they work on Chromebooks.

content: Lecture Notes is a good for note talking and organization. It's active stylus stylus aware and has ability to have notebooks with infinite pages and multiple notebooks with a folder. I am a university professor. I mainly use this app as a note taking device that replaces my paper note pad. Recently, I projected my Samsung Tab S3 onto a TV using Roku so that all of my writing in the tablet can be seen in the TV and my graduate students can see the writing much better. This is by far the best note taking app in the Android system. I have tried several others. The things I like are: (1) the writing is very very smooth. You do not see the difference from witing on paper. (2) the note is always there and can be found long time after. (I started to use the LectureNotes after I purchased my Samsung Tab S3 in summer of 2017). (3) the zoom function is very neat. You can double tap and it becomes 125% zoom. Double tap again, you return to the original 100% zoom. (4) the app provided a lot of control in the setting, which I think is very useful as a frequent user. (5) more recently, I figured out a way to back up all the notes in PDF format into my Dropbox flder. This is very helpful because I can now access my notes in my Window 10 computer. (6) It has the back up feature to back up all the information into a zip file in Dropbox. I would think that I can import the zip file into my new tablet. (7) It seems to me the app does not take too much of the Tablet space. I could be wrong on this. The file size of the zip backup 140MB. I have a lot of notes (around 100, all of them are hand writing with mostly 10 page or more.) (8) it allows me to create a lot of folders ad sub folders. This helps me to get my notes organized.

Excellent app. Very useful for making notes for my pupils. However, several well-known features that MS office has are absent. Great app for taking notes on Android. I do find that the handwriting 
engine in Squid is slightly better, although they had support from Google 
on that. LectureNotes allows you to record your lectures and has tons of 
usability features and options that Squid is lacking. Squid is also more 
expensive as you either need a subscription or purchase their in-app packs 
(like $8 for pdf import and tool pack). Overall if the ability to record 
your lectures intrigues you, you need more customization, or you want a 
single purchase app, then LectureNotes, otherwise probably recommend Squid 
if you don't care about recording and so on.

I have been using LectureNotes for about a year now to take notes in my university classes and it has been a lifesaver! I no longer have to carry around a stack of notebooks; instead I just carry my tablet and have all of my notes right there.  LectureNotes works fantastic right from the start but with the degree of customization offered you can tune it perfectly to your needs. I have even started using it for things outside of school! It does not require an internet connection like some notebook apps so you really can use it anywhere. Being able to import images and PDFs is great, especially when combined with my tablet's built in screen grab feature and digital textbooks. Indexing pages makes going back through your notes a breeze, too!  The developer has also been very quick to respond to questions.  I recommend LectureNotes to anyone looking for a way to take notes digitally.

Great app! Have everything you need! It allows you to organize the notebooks and create files. You can export your notebooks in PDF if you want later. The app is really fast, it never crashes. I don't suppose Acadoid wants to pay me for the 8 hours lost because I put my trust in this app (PAID version, by the way)...
replyContent: Random reboot suggests hardware problem (app cannot cause a reboot); any hardware problem tends to worsen with time, so that frequency of random reboots (and other `weird´ behavior of device) will increase.

LectureNotes has what I feel is a perfect set of tools for what it is designed for: taking notes, making diagrams with an active stylus tablet.  Good performance on Galaxy Note 10.1 2014.  The interface for selecting pens/erasers/drawing tools is unobtrusive and allows you to work quickly.  New users may need to spend some time to figure out which settings they prefer and customizing their toolbox, but it is worth doing so.  The simple to use snap to grid tools are very useful if you are drawing plots / writing math or engineering-oriented notes.  Versatile export / share funtionality.  My only gripe after using for over 3 yrs is selecting layers is sort of clunky (need to drop down a menu to see what layer you are working in or switch active/visible layers - I would prefer the active layer / layer toggles to be displayed in the toolbox or somewhere where it was always visible, because sometimes I forget what layer I am working in).

Pressure sensitive stylus, custom pencils and eraser, draw with stylus / erase with finger, basic geometric shapes, very good selection tools, layers... content: Lecturenotes is definitely the most useful app in my Samsung Note devices. And it's also way better than the oh-so-sluggish S-Note. It provides TONS of features not present in S-Note, including:    - Layer - Cut & Paste - Continues page browsing + scrolling with GESTURE (eg using two fingers, continued with 1 finger) -> that's genius! - Page management (how do you EVEN copy or move pages between notebooks in s-note??) - Adjustable notebook overview - Pencil draws behind other color - Velocity sensitive < love it!! > (I set it to 40% and it imitates fountain pen BEAUTIFULLY).  I can now use any Samsung stylus for any Samsung Galaxy Note (1, 2, 10.1, 8) (no more 'too thin' or 'too thick' problem caused by different stylus pressure sensitivity)

The learning curve is extremely steep. I've done S-Note for years, Squid (formerly Papyrus) for years too, and this program is far far more complete and stable and writes much more smoothly. So there's no way I couldn't give this 5 stars and A big thank you to the dev. But goodness, there are so many very simple and basic things provided by those other programs that could be done so much easier here. Like picking a color for pencils is so difficult here, or cropping an inserted image, or selecting objects (like an image, or a line), that well, are made here extremely difficult. You can still do these things but it's very tedious. If it wasn't that the program has so many other things that make up for these short comings and if I didn't see the effort and obvious dedication the developer has put into this program, along with the customer service they provide,  then I wouldn't have given it 5 stars. Please sir(s), developer(s), please fix these issues, they are very very annoying. I hope that you consider my complaint seriously..... But again, I reiterate, it is definitely better than S-Note our Squid, which I consider to be the other 2 best note taking apps out there.

My most important criteria were:  intuitive and efficient interface; key interface elements visible on black and white e-ink screen; acceptable lag when using the stylus; Aaility to rename notes; ability to search notes by filename; flexible sorting options; ability to back up my notes.  LectureNotes covers these and much-much more: undo, copy-paste, visual rearrangement of pages, default file names with yyyy-mm-dd format, sharing aoptions, etc., etc., etc. . Excellent app and responsive developer, highly recommended!

content: This app is amazing. It seems like most rave reviews here are from students actually taking lecture notes (go figure!), but I wanted to leave a review from a professional point of view. I'm an attorney and I got this app years ago so I wouldn't have to shuffle through a briefcase full of files everyday in court. I loved it. I've actually been teaching for the last few years and I'm getting ready to go back in to private practice, and the app is as good as ever. The ONLY downside to this app is that there are so many features and options that it might be a little intimidating for a casual user. I imagine that's probably the reason for anything less than a 5 star review. If that applies to you, stick with Google Keep, Squid, or even Evernote, because this is over-kill for making a shopping list. But if you have a need for tons of detailed notes, you won't find anything better than LectureNotes. P.S. -- I'm using a Note 10.1 2014 edition.

replyContent: Even though LN usage of many individual files to store notebook pages is ideal for syncing your notes, LN does not sync with cloud services. There are too many different cloud services and syncing is better done by the specialized app of your favorite cloud service or general syncing apps.

content: Excellent application

Working well for me so far taking electronic engineering lab notes on my Galaxy Note Pro. I really like being able to set the wide range of defaults as I want i.e. small fonts so I can get more on a page, cover colour - I have shades of green for active projects then can turn the red when completed. I can directly import PDFs, though I had to set the resolution higher to see the text on schematics, but at least that is now set as a default. Much more flexible than S Note where I found if I wanted Hi res PDFs I had to import them into Scrapbook first the import into S Note. I find LectureNotes much easier to use than S Notes. Some usage notes;- I tried the trial version first, liked it so bought the full version. It installs as a separate app, so I had to use a file manager to cut and paste the notebooks I had written into the full version directories, but I found that my settings did not transfer so I had to set them up again. Maybe I missed a file. Would be easier if the full version just upgraded the trial version as some apps do, but it is done now and the trial version uninstalled, so no biggy. OOps ran out of space!!
I have a Galaxy Tab pro 12.1 .... I use Lecture Notes for everything from work to home .. just wish there was back up .

Best APP for taking notes on android. Been using it for 2 years now. The ONLY PROBLEM I have with it, and it's so severe that I actually stopped using this app to take notes is an issue with the text layer. (the layer that lets you write text with a keyboard)   The specific issue is that when you re-size text. Sometimes when you leave the notebook and reopen it your text will resize back to default values. This sometimes turns into a ALWAYS if you export the notebook then import it  back into lecture notes. Re-sizing all your text back to what is was before can be a DAUNTING TASK when your notebook can have excess of 50+ pages.

content: Great for regular notetaking.

I bought my tablet so that I can make tutorial videos for my maths classes. I initially just got the main lecture notes app and I was looking for a screen recording app. It was a bit of a pain to find a good screen recorder but the best of one's recorded the top line of my tablet where the time and battery is displayed which I thought would be distracting for my videos. I then noticed that lecture notes has an extension that allows you to record the screen for a good price so I gave that a go. Initially I thought there wasn't a pointer but I thought it'll still do for me but I emailed the developer anyway and he helped me find the pointer and now I have the perfect setup for my needs!
Fully customisable, amazingly intuitive. Genuinely a pleasure to work now I use this app. Cheers to the developers.

This app has the whole package! A nice UI, great organization and endless pen and writing options. The writing has filters to smooth the input and reduce noise. So if you are looking for a powerful organization system with an awesome writing experience, this is the app for you! *Note, you have to play with the pen settings to get the desired writing effect, so don't discount it until you fiddle with the settings first.
I tried many app of this kind and lecture notes was by far the best. Although it would be even better with a cloud service.
Love it.

Great app! Now I do all my note on my galaxy note pro! The only issue is that we can't sync our note to cloud services like Dropbox or Onedrive etc. Hope the syncing function will be added in the future, even if it's a paid add-on I will buy it!

content: I've tried several similar apps, and even paid for a few. This one allows taking notes as I would on paper. This is the reason that I have a stylus.

The app has many settings which can be set. Despite its functionality, the app can't save my notes somewhere safe (Dropbox, Google Drive, e.g.), but only manually on SD card. I have already faced situations when I almost lost notes because of tablet's malfunction. And I barely can use keyboard, because such typing is too slow.  Therefore I have been forced to find different app. It's a pity. UPD: they are always replying that one can use a third-party app for syncing, but they forgot to mention that rooting device is needed then.

impeccable

This is an awesome app!  I use this for every class.  It's very versitile.  I love the use of layers which is an awesome way to test yourslef by hiding the answers in a layer.  I like the autosave, but I don't like that it lags as it saves.  I would like to see some updates done.  I would want to be able to export specific pages via pdf.  Right now it only allows to export only one page or the whole notebook.  I would also like to see an update on being able to annotate my notes while listening to the recordings of Lecture Recording.    Thanks so much for making this app!!
realy great app. Thanks for the reply ;)

content: The BEST note taking app I have. I use it on my Galaxy Note 10.1 (2014) and it does what I need, and then some. It was a bit overwhelming at first use, but after a bit of playing around and familiarizing myself with it I can honestly say it is my "go-to" app for all writing. It seems like a simple notebook app on first glance, but don't let that fool you. It is very in depth and has a ton of useful features that other apps I've tried don't have. From what I can tell you can pretty much customize every aspect of each notebook and tool through the settings menu.
It ticked all these boxes for me - easy to use, screen cast,  OK cost, lots of helpful features.

The app was purchased accidentally due some rubble installing and teenagers who should not be playing on the app store. I had asked for a refund and the developer got back to me imediatly but for some reason Google play did not refund me. Not the devs fault.  Since it was obvious I was going to own the app, like it or not, I started playing with it a bit.  Now mind you, I have been using the full version of incredible which is just that but it lacks the immense customization that Lecture notes has. I'm slowly being converted. I would love to see more pen types. Such as incredible has. The fountain pen makes your writing so elegant looking. But as far as versatility and usability I am actually glad I didn't get refunded. I'm heading back to university this fall and I think this may be my go to notebook app. Good job dev. Thanks for the hard work.

This app is (IMO) THE best app in its class.  However, it is / can be a bit overwhelming when you're first get started.  Don't sweat it, I'd suggest hitting up YouTube and watching some videos to familiarize yourself. It does get easier with time and use; the benefits are TOTALLY worth it!!!  I've used it on my Note 3 and it was great, but it REALLY Shines on my Note 10.1 (2014)!!!!!!!  Don't hesitate if you're on the fence, it is definitely worth every cent! It only gets better with each update.
Great from start to finish once you have it customized.

Great, but terrible defaults.  This app does almost everything I want, but a fresh install is near to useless.  All of the stuff I consider important - like line smoothing and logarithmic pen sizes, tightly-spaced icons, page sizes, menu sizes, they're -all- wrong.  This means the first time you try it things extend off the screen, menus are half missing, menu icons scroll off the screen with huge amounts of wasted whitespace, the stylus isn't detected, pens are WAY too small, and resizing is nigh uncontrollable.  All of these things can be fixed, but why do I have to do all this research, fiddling around and doing the dev's work?  Lecture Notes is better than any other note taking app, but you wouldn't know it until you fix it yourself.

I have used this a lot last year as a student. It is absolutely the best of its kind. I handwrite notes and this app probably saved a forest in the last year alone.  It works great with ezpdf reader, it can take the snap shots from there so you can integrate excerpts from books or articles in your notes. Great use of pencils and palettes,  it does more that you think at first sight and it seems the developer is on the ball and helpful. Recommended, if you need a note taking ago, this is it.
I suggested an additional feature which the developer implemented immediately. Would rate ten stars!
Just everything you need plus some!

Everything a student needs. Everything a professional needs.  Everything an educator needs, if you install recordings and lecture video.   Great functionality with the stylus pen, very clear writing resolution, different pencils and pens types, colors and thickness can be configured for ease of access. There is an icon for drawing basic shapes as well. There are also options for downloading entire pdfs, or specific pages, and writing on top of those for note taking in class.   You can cut, edit, copy and erase easily. Replaces paper (in fact saves paper) Maybe this app should be up for the Nobel Peace prize...  You can organize folders and notebooks..give them specific colors.  Best app out there.
This is my second brain.  Would like to see a magnified note feature like inkredible, and sync over multiple devices

I run a company and working with a Samsung Note tablet and now phone with LN has been a huge lift. Strongly recommend it. Pull in PDFs to annotate and export back out, completely eliminate paper, set up a page for random notes as a widget on home screen and many other helpful things work great.

I searched for a good note taking app for my Samsung Note Tablet. OneNote was laggy, ezPDFReader was only good for editing pdf handouts, and many others couldn't fulfill my needs. This app is smooth, easy to navigate, and has many great features. The only downside for me is that it took me this long to find it!

I'm sure it works for what it is intended to work for but PDF import was extremely slow (about 4sec/page). Also it could be a lot less complicated. Activating PDF import, or many other features, is a multi-step process. The settings, while highly customizable, are too much. I just wanted an app that would import lecture PDFs for note taking, similar to Notability on iOS. Thought this app would do it well. I regret paying for this.
Nice note taking app, love it

It's rare I buy apps let alone leave feedback but this app is worth every penny and every star. A superb S-Note replacement which I missed very much when I started using custom roms. I tried a few others some of which were very good (nod to you Papyrus) but this beats all the competition rolled into one. I have minor quibbles like scrolling dialogue boxes in portrait mode but it's a small price to pay for all the functionality on offer. Highly recommended. Thanks devs :-)

A brilliant note-taking app, extremely versatile, with a natural feel and all the functions you could need. For me the only one and the best - I've been using it for years and never yet found anything to match it.
It would be great more with several pen types, such as fountain pen , brush etc.
Customizable yet easy to use. Adds enormously to the value of the s-pen.
The best one of its kind.

I bought this to experiment with using an old galaxy note 10.1 as alternate input to a clunky interactive whiteboard in school. (I use chromecast or mobizen to project/mirror my screen). This app is nothing short of brilliant. It intuitively does what you want the way you want it done and every time I've thought "wouldn't it be great if I could do this?" it has turned out that I can. The most recent example being that I could turn the icon of saved notes into an image of the first page of those notes. This is the best android app I have ever bought. No question. If you want to make notes, buy it. If you want to project your work, buy it especially if you have a galaxy note. Perfect, perfect app.
This app is the main reason I purchased my tablet with the s - pen.  It just works, period.

Still needs to have automatic sync between devices. Would be nice with more paper templates, such as a templates for meeting memos with fields for attendees/date&time/location/notes etc. Perhaps day and week planning templates too, and why not a to do checklist type of template... If there would be a selectable option to smooth out my sloppy handwriting, I would be glad to pay for such additions

content: The upside to this app as compared to, say, the Snote (on the Galaxy note 10.1) is its high degree of customizability.  I use this to do a *lot* of writing, and it works great!
Full of features, although not as beautiful as bamboo paper. Totally wort it
Fantastic app, a must have for galaxy note tablets
Have been using this for 2 years now and foind nothing that compares. It keeps getting better and better and if you have queries,  the team is extremely helpful. Simply love it!
The best
Brilliant! !

very slow to import 200 hundered pages of pdf. Suggestion: It would be very nice if the software could annotate pdf files directly without changing them to image and reducing the quality. With features of Input Zone and S Pen and the most importing one, adding a page in between.
Very well planned note app. Has a lot of features that you can set up for your own usage instead of how they think you might want it.

Best app I've ever purchased. This turns my galaxy note 10.1 into an incredible life changing device. I no longer carry books,pen or paper to class. Just my note. Thank u lecture notes! If I ever met the dev in person I would definitely buy him a beer! Helpful and responsive. Great job!
I use this app every day at work.  I think I've tried all note taking apps and this is by far my favorite.

Very useful. I use it to take notes in class. I admit it does take a long time to customize it the way you want and to discover all the possible features, but once you get past that, it works amazingly.  As a side note, I wish Cloud Syncing could somehow be enhanced. Like automatically syncing within the app, instead of relying on a third party app.

This app is perfect for creating lectures and uploading them for students to view as videos and it is also great for general note taking. Everything is customisable and any questions or support needed is quickly and promptly addressed by the developers. Well put together, I highly recommend this app. Thank You!

Could you guys also allow me to make just notes that without having to put them in a notebook, that would be helpful. This app is amazing, my word you guys have done a great job. It is so customisable. At first it looked very overwhelming but once you get used to it you will realise that all the features come so in handy especially for math students and the like. I  am very satisfied with my purchase, this app combines everything i need in a note taking app wow! Keep up the good work. I look forward to more

After trying out seven other Apps to take notes this is by far the best out there.  I primarily use this for work on my Samsung Note 10.1, but with my personal life as well.  With this one app I can take notes, create schedules, and easily import images, PDFs, use multiple layers all in one.  The ability to quickly create and categorize notebooks makes for an outstanding organizer.  The ability to export any of these notebooks, is just icing on the cake.  Above all else, it is very well integrated with using the S pen. If you are looking for an outstanding note app for your tablet, you have just found the best out there.
Nice app. Like it
Very easy to use and light weight.
Still waiting for edit PDF without import to .png first. But overall, this is the best note taking.

Needs a cosmetic remodel, and controls/customizations are a little difficult to navigate sometimes, but this note-taking app is absolutely stellar. Printing from an exported PDF copy of my notes is very clear and as good as OneNote in my opinion. Worth the money to buy this app if you're a paperless kind of person. This app is even more valuable if your device has a digitizing stylus.

I am new to taking college notes digitally and so far it's been great - especially with this app as it runs smoothly on my galaxy note 10.1 2012 ed. However one issue I currently have is in transferring my notes from the trial version. My dropbox is currently full, so I don't know any other way to transfer, them. Please help!

SOOOO close to perfect... I love this app, handwriting is great, audio recordings are nice, but it would be great if it highlighted the text along with the audio instead of just scrolling the page, and there is a little bit of lag when typing in text--why?!  I hate to mention notability, and the way everything is sort of greyed out until it gets to that part corresponding to the audio, but it works.  Please fix the lag, and add highlight/grey out text and then this app is unbeatable! On a galaxy note 10.1 2014 edition with all android updates and app updates.

Great App, with lots of options available. The most complete note taking app I've found so far.  It takes a while to learn all the features the app offers but its well worth the time. Some improvements I would suggest are: 1. Be able to edit PDFs  directly  (not just import a picture of each page) 2. Be able to export  automatically to evernote any update on a note previously synced. (So I don't end up with multiple copies of the same note each time I manually sync it) 3. Improve the audio recording add-on to have more control over the quality and format of the recordings
This is the greatest I've seen.  A plethora of options and useful,  versatile functionality.Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1

Currently using a Samsung Galaxy note 10.1 and this app works great on the device.  The only real complaint I have is in regards to the palm rejection as I tend to leave unintentional scribbles when my palm touches the screen occasionally.  Other than that, really enjoy using the app!

I've been using this product for over 1.5 years now and it continues to be one of my favorite apps of all times. They constantly make it better and it never disappoints. If you're a student or a teacher, this app is a must have.

Great

This app has all but eliminated my need for writing on paper. I take all of my notes for physics and math ( college upper-level courses ) Once I perfect printing on engineering paper I'll be able to complete my homework in LectureNotes. My only 'complaint' is that sometimes drawing coordinate axes, and the like, often takes multiple attempts and sometimes a little finesse. This is the result of lifting the s-pen away from the screen, causing my line to move ever so slightly.  I realize there may be little that can be done for that though, and may be purely an artifact of the relationship between the pen and the screen.  All of that being said,  keep up the excellent work. Also, the more bells and whistles the better, provided they don't bog it down. l LOVE this app, have I mentioned that yet?
After using this app for almost 2 years, I have determined that its a diamond. The app is fully functional smooth and very customization.
replyContent: Install the free app PDFView and restart LectureNotes, then there will be additional menu entries and the PDF import settings will be accessible.

Really productive application as a college student. My only SUGGESTION is to incorporate google drive to automatically backup notes there.

content: So useful, math, drawing, or notes
A app full of features. Could do with a highlighter Though, to highlight PDFs or handwritten apps

There are 3 things that if changed would bring my rating to 5/5. Firstly, when importing a document I would like to see folders and subfolders, subsubfolders etc rather than a huge list of all of the folders I have, being a uni student I sort based I year of uni (up to 5), subject (8 per year) and topic (up to 12 per subject) having this huge list all the time is super annoying. Secondly,  being able to flip an imported document from landscape to portrait or vice versa after import. It can take a long time to import a 100 slide document only to realise it's the wrong orientation and having to delete it and reimport.  Finally,  being able to search the typed text you've made in text boxes, rather than just what you've typed in the type layer, would be a huge help.  In a lecture note format I want to write my notes by the slide and be able to find relevant information quickly. I hope to see these improvements I future updates!
Extremely useful!

This is a great app wether it's for taking notes during lectures or to simply use it as an alternative to paper to write down your calculations (for maths, physics, chemistry, etc). Cheers to the devs! Also, I have a small suggestion for the eraser; could it be possible to erase a bunch of writings just by doing a circle around the writings with the eraser  instead of manually erasing it (Interactive boards use this system). It would be easier and faster. Anyways, thanks for this app, it is worth the money!

It works great for my medic class. I can take all the notes I want. with the scanner attachment and the recording I can record my lectures and input my class documents right into my notes. The ability to export is huge! I share notes with class mates through Dropbox all the time!
Its the best app for taking notss that I have come across,  also it has a huge amount of easy to use functions

It has a wealth of options for customizations, like nothing I've seen on any mobile app. I love how it easily exports to onenote. Works really well on my galaxy note 4 ,and takes full advantage of stylus and digitizer. It is so well worth the modest cost. One request: please add easy export to Google Keep.  Thanks!

I never take pen and paper to meetings or seminars any more, there is just no need to. I can make a journal of my thoughts, a quick note or letter,  even draw out an idea. If I can do it on a note pad, I can do it here.  Constant updates and improvements.  It just gets better and better.
I chose Android over Apple for this app. The application just keeps getting better. I hope people support the developer by buying the app as it is frequently updated.
By far the best handwriting app out there. I use it all the time. So worth the price for pro.
I love being able to take notes any where and being able to create folders and notebooks to categorize my work. This app works well with Samsung note II tablet and phone.
Hands down the best note taking app on android! Tonnes of features, easy to use, fantastic support, constant updates.
Switched from s note as this is better and more stable.  It would be nice to be able just to cut and paste directly from other applications though.

I'm lazy at reviews but I really like this

content: This app's biggest feature is also its biggest drawback: it is extremely customizable. This is nice because you can make it do EXACTLY what you want. This is not so nice because all that customization requires time and tweaking, so it isn't very useful 'right out of the box'. Also, all of that customization makes some of the features unintuitive. Even with all of those drawbacks, I'm giving the app 5 stars because once it is set up, it is an extremely powerful note taking app. The developer responds quickly
replyContent: The text layer works essentially like an embedded text editor or word processor, but there is also a text drawing tool that allows free placement; it can be accessed either via the pencil toolbox or via the drawing tools menu.

content: Firstly, I love the app. I'm a senior in Electrical Engineering and I use it to take all my notes and do my homework on my Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 ed. Way better than Snotes! However, one feature that would be nice is the ability to import more than one pdf page at a time into a notebook. I export all my professor's slides to pdf and then import them into LectureNotes and add comments and examples where necessary, however, my current solution is to, every time I get a new set of slides, convert the slides to a pdf, export the notebook as a pdf, append the slides pdf to the notebook pdf, and then re-import the whole pdf as a new notebook. It works, it's just kind of a pain. And because you can import one pdf page at a time, I don't see why you couldn't import a range of pages. Anyways, that's my two cents, GREAT APP! THANK YOU!

content: Awesome note take app!! The best to use with the S-Pen!

Went from iPad to G Note 10.1 for the S pen (for half the $$ of a Surface Pro).  S-Note was clunky, & Papyrus, was pretty good--PDF support, backup to Dropbox easy.... but it costs a lot more than Lecture Notes, and in the end, it was lacking some functionality for me--you can't see the page when you scroll, etc., etc...    ENTER LECTURE NOTES!! After some tweaking I can export a pdf and send it to my dropbox (ONE BUTTON EXPORT TO DROPBOX/DRIVE WOULD BE NICE, but DropSync gets the job done automatically), although it DOES export a PNG to Evernote no sweat (one button)!  Then I can search through my notes for handwritten text like I could in S-Note!! Awesome!  Best of all, the tools and menus are all customizable, you can see the page while scrolling, you can scroll to the next page and see the last page, it's more intuitive, & it's cheaper to top it off!!  If you get the other apps they offer you spend like $5 and you can record audio while you take notes and do all the stuff that notability does, & do stuff with PDFs.  This app REALLY makes the G Note 10.1 a contender for actually taking handwritten notes on a tablet & keeping them organized! Thank you for a great app!!!
Great for making plans on screen. I love handwriting my notes in this app.

Definitely the best and easiest to use, and the one best at replicating paper feeling, but lacks cloud sync which means that it is worthless if I need to have the same notes on multiple devices (which for me is a must).
replyContent: Even though LN usage of many individual files to store notebook pages is ideal for syncing your notes, LN does not sync with cloud services. There are too many different cloud services and syncing is better done by the specialized app of your favorite cloud service or general syncing apps.

content: For the price, it does a pretty good job!

My only complaint is after the recent update the hide/show input zone button randomly disappears from the pencil drop down list. I have to exit the notebook and go back in the get it back, definitely not worth taking any stars off though. Overall, an impressive app!                      Update: This app is just the beez neez! content: I used to make millions of notes on paper, at all angles to separate them, as if paper was expensive, then I would lose the paper or have so many scraps that I could not find the notes. Writing on a Note 8 with this app rather than the built in 'Note' permits very small writing and no hand marks at all. In fact the back button was the worst issue, but turning the screen upside down solved that. I cannot tell the difference between the old paper and this, providing you use a Galaxy Note. I cannot speak for any other. Buy this... it has every option and tweak you could ever imagine or need... there is not another app to compare.

If you want handwriting recognition on the fly look elsewhere, and good luck because that's not the most efficient way to take notes.  For pure handwriting and sketching during meetings/lectures this application is hands down the best.  Once you set it up the way you want and familiarize yourself with the interface taking notes during events where subjects are rapidly jumping around is a breeze since it is quick to select and move portions of your notes around on the page.  PDF support is amazing and I often find myself going into a meeting with a notebook file that I create via PDF import of an agenda or other document that I can then simply take notes over.  Fantastic!
Use this app daily in university and absolutely love its convenience and usefulness.

content: I downloaded an image of green engineering paper and set the pixies of a new notebook equal to that picture, then I set that image as the background of the notebook. Once the document is complete it can be exported as a PDF to look just like a scan of the real thing. This can be done for ANY type of paper.  It does take a whole to set up the drawing tools and other setting, but totally worth it.
Used papyrus for a while, but quickly replaced with this one. More options and customization to fit my needs

I used this instead of the S-Note app on my Galaxy Note 10.1 (2014). Although the pen mark is not as smooth as the S-Note's, the features are superb and everything I needed. It made writing notes fun and efficient with the ability to import images and pdfs then mark them up with minimal fuss. As a medical professional, I need to deal with and sign pdfs all the time. The most important features for me when writing notes are the ability to: - Insert a space to insert extra information when I come across it even after finishing the note - Insert images/tables into my notes seamlessly - Export to Evernote - Sync (via a 3rd party app) daily to Google Drive to keep files backed up.  NB: I had an issue when I upgraded to KitKat and could not save/modify my files on the ext SD anymore. The developer got in contact with me within 12 hrs of my previous review and gave me the solution (which involved amending the extsd path name slightly).

content: Never can have too many options

So, lecture notes, is pretty ugly in comparison to some of the other options out there and especially to notability. The program itself allows for tons of customization and saving settings on the SD card in case you move tablets. It does PDFs pretty well, it has great integration with ES explorer as well as Google Drive. Creating all of the preferences is pretty complicated for a newbie however, it gets the job done. Overall I am a fan. As of right now, my only problem is that it doesn't seem to be playing well (specifically with graphical "hiccups") with lollipop on my nVidia Shield Tablet. Still works great on my Nexus 7. The only reason I won't  give this app a five star is because you have to install another piece of software for PDFs to work, there aren't very clear instructions on use, and the support for lollipop is a bit laggy.
As everyone else has been saying, this app is absolutely amazing. The amount of options is absolutely insane, which for me is great as too many other apps don't have the options this does.

The customer service help for LectureNotes is one of the best I've ever seen. This is a developer that really cares about his product, and about his customers. He emailed me back very quickly and helped me fix my problem of my notebook disapearing super easily. I totally recommend the product itself as well. I've totally replaced paper with my Samsung Note tablet, and could not be happier for listening to all those who recommended this app. The small price is definitely worth it!

content: I'm a teacher at a school that does not have integrated tablet technology in the classrooms.  At my old school, I would use this technology to keep a record off class notes as I went along.  This was useful to me when I taught the class again, and useful to the students to take the pressure off them for note-taking; they would still take notes, if they needed to think or pay attention instead, they would have time to do so.    I got a Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 and Lecture notes, and I am now able to do what used to do.  I can import a PDF and annotate that as notes for a class.  I do have to make sure the font size is large enough that the students can see it from the screen.  I can save notes as a PDF and post for my students.    The Acadoid developers were very prompt in responding to my questions and also pointed me to a Wikia page that had a manual for Lecture Notes.  It was definitely a good buy for me.

Now its laggin pretty hard on my note pro 12.2. Won't allow me to keep up in class... content: I started using this to take notes in my engineering classes after trying out several others that weren't to my taste. I've been using LectureNotes for almost 2 years, and absolutely love it. I can have all my notes neatly organized and all my comments and side notes color coded. After recent surgery, I can't carry a lot of notebooks etc. This has allowed me to eliminate my paper notebooks.  I have become the guy my classmates go to when they miss class.  The only improvement I could see is convert handwriting to text and Better copy / paste functionality I havea lot of other now programs and it would be great ifI could simply colt/paste those notes into this app. Overall, great application.

I have been taking notes using exclusively this app for over a semester now, studying computer engineering. The convenience of having all my notes digitally is unbelievable. I even sometimes catch myself trying to use functionality supplied by this app when writing on regular paper, such as quickly conjuring up a table, or moving a selection of writing to the other side of the page.  I hooked it up with Dropsync, so all my notes appear in Dropbox if I want to refer to something on my computer. And it's easy to export assignments when professors want a paper copy turned in for grading.  My only gripe, while minor, is I think the settings menu could do with a major overhaul. This app is extremely customizable, which is one of its strengths, but it's very difficult and unintuitive to find where a setting you want to change might be located. Some study and application of user interface design could help a lot.
I never do the rating but this app is great - student, business, you name it..it works!

I wish I could give 4.5 stars because this app is almost perfect!  I've been searching for a replacement to SNote for quite some time -- and I finally found it.  LectureNotes allows you to have select-and-moveable annotations that are still editable (I love the layer interface!), has better quality pdf exports, has more than 2-3 shades of grey, as well as a number of other cool features.  I also think that importing and exporting pdfs is faster than with SNote. It is very customizable, smooth and for the most part very easy to use.    I do have 2 minor complaints - (1) I didn't like having to install two auxiliary apps to annotate PDFs (a file manager + PDFView) and (2) I wish there was a quick access color wheel and size scale for the pencil.  Needing to create/switch to a custom pencil takes a lot of effort when all I want to do is temporarily change the color/size.

I used this app all last year on a generic tablet with a cheap stylus.  There were so many options that I was able to write with the screen zoomed in (large writing) and then be able to export it at normal size.  The options for this were endless.  I was able to set margins to detect stylus input and the screen would automatically tab to the next position (so I wouldn't have to scroll).   Getting used to the layers and importing screenshots etc takes a bit of getting used to and could possibly be a little bit more intuitive but again, all of the options that you could ever need are there waiting for you (allbeit if they are sometimes hidden within multiple settings menus). I have now uprgraded to a Note 10.1 2014 and had a look at Samsung's note taking apps.  Wow, the difference is huge.  Samsung's appear very childlike and crude compared to this.   For what you get this app is very, VERY cheap.  Yes you may have to pay for the recordings add on but even then it is extremely good value.  After using the app for over a year I would happily pay more for it.

Update 1 - Is been improved. I love it even more! Update 2 - Updating to Kit Kat for the Note 2014 disables the ability to save to the SD card. I wish Acadia can find a way around it.
replyContent: Google has revised access to the external SD card in Android 4.4 (KITKAT), non-system apps can no longer freely access it. You can use the external SD card if you set the app directory to ${EXTSDCARD}/Android/data/com.acadoid.lecturenotes/files (where ${EXTSDCARD} is to be replaced by the path of the external SD card on your device).

content: Of all the note pads I've tried for the original Note, this is the only one with an acceptable startup latency.

Export ppt to pdf (polaris office for samsung note devices). Then import to lecture notes. Set to top of page for pdf import in settings and voila.....  Then you can write on or beneath lecture slides.   Dont forget to add another text layer or you risk erasing notes.

I have the Samsung Galaxy 10.1 2014 edition, and I prefer lecture notes over Snote. Although Snote has a few more functionalities that lecture notes, it is really slow. Lecture notes is far more customisable and 10 times faster at page turning and overall navigating. if there's one thing snote does better though, is that the writing  comes out far smoother. The letters on lecture notes sometimes come out a bit wobbly, so if they can fix that then it would surpass Snote in every category. I also wish that lecture notes would polish up its interface a bit in terms of looks. But for now, lecture notes is my go-to notes app.

I am absolutely content with this app. I tried half a dozen apps in the Spring semester and was amazed with how great this app is on a Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 Edition and Note 3. I can open documents in pdf or word and use Air Command on Note 10.1 and Note 3 to clip parts of the notes that I want on the app, import images, erase part of the image and write on top of it. I am a great note taker but I have never had my notes look so good. Handwriting on this app is sharp(dependent on tablet and pen) and just as good as using a real pen/pencil. I can sort out different classes into folders and have sub folders for each chapter. I can easily switch between different colors of pens and pencils. Autosaves and notes can be exported to PDF. Not a single thing to complain about in 5 months of using this app!!
Takes a bit of getting used to all of the many option. Once you set it up the way you want your book to be, it is very easy. Or just use the default.
When i zoom or scroll,  it is getting slow down for a instant. It needs better handling algorithm.  I'm using on galaxy note 10.1 2014 edition and hardware graphic accelerator is off
replyContent: Try to enable `use fast page rendering´ (not to be mixed with `use fast temporary rendering´) in the app's display settings, then a faster rendering algorithm is used. The difference will hardly be noticeable on a high resolution display (except for extreme zoom levels), but response to writing, scrolling, and zooming will significantly improve.

replyContent: LectureNotes cannot directly handle PDF, you need to install the free helper app PDFView. Restart LectureNotes after installation, then there will be additional menu entries and the PDF import settings will be accessible.

content: A must have app for my Note 10.1

Great app!
Highly recommend it.

First of all, I love this app and I love the customizable features available. I also love the developer's support. Its an almost perfect app. However, I do have one issue.  And my issue is not an easy one. I have read threads and understand that with the way LN is coded it is impossible to edit previously entered text. This is becoming a real issue and its frustrating because I love all the other features of LN so much. Is a fix in the works? Maybe be able to access the last couple text boxes? Also I've had some issues where I'd line up my text box so everything fit into a space, only to enter it in, and have the text spill to the next line, causing it to overlap another layer and cause me to have to erase it all (or cut and move) again. I can live with this annoyance though. I'd realllllllly love a text editing option. I know it would be a lot of work, but it makes the software difficult to use as a professional device if I can not fix a misspelling easily.   Thanks!!
How I can import pdf files to Lecture notes ?
replyContent: LectureNotes cannot directly handle PDF, it needs the free helper app PDFView. Restart LectureNotes after installation, then there will be additional menu items and the PDF import settings will be accessible.

content: Its a great note taking app, especially if you have a device with a built in stylus, like me. replyContent: You can set default font properties for the text layer in the text layer setup in the app's handling settings and for the text drawing tool in the text drawing tool setup in the app's tools settings.

replyContent: Even though LectureNotes usage of many individual files to store notebook pages is ideal for syncing your notes, LectureNotes does not directly sync with cloud services. There are too many different cloud services and syncing is better done by the specialized app of your favorite cloud service or general syncing apps.

This is by far the best app ever. I have been using this app for more than a year on my note 10.1 for school and I can't imagine going back to pen and paper. I know since the Note Pro is new, there are some differences to expect on how this app works in this new environment. I found when taking notes in split screen using Lecture Notes, I cannot take notes on the right side of the screen. I must put Lecture Notes on the left half of the split screen and whatever my other open app is, on the right side. The Note Pro is large enough to allow for this and more. I used to do that on the Note 10.1, but the screen was almost too small for that purpose. Anyway, new support for the Note Pro 12.2 would be great. Also, the Note Pro lets you open multiple instances of the same app. I would love to see this offered in Lecture Notes...I would be willing to pay extra for an add-on capable of such a function. Having two notebooks open side-by-side in Lecture Notes would be the Bomb!!!

content: I love it!

This is a great app. Very easy to take notes, import pdf's and mark on them, etc. The palm rejection is perfect, and it's great to be able to use fingers to navigate and zoom and the stylus to write, with the app never confusing the two.  I used to scribble notes on random scrap paper while on the phone. Now I scribble them here and always have them in one place, oragnized and not taking up any room or making any messes. I also download lecture notes for university classes and then follow along in class, highlighting and writing margin notes as I see fit.  My only real complaint is that importing pdf's takes a rather long time, especially when it's more than two or three pages. I will often start importing a slideshow right at the beginning of class and have to wait almost 10 minutes before I can actually use it and mark on it.  It would be nice if there was an easier way to export something to pdf and email it directly. I've done it, but I've had to use fairly roundabout methods.  The other minor suggestion I would make would be to have yellow and/or white in the group of default pens. I often import slideshows using dark backgrounds and have to use custom pens to mark on them.

I use the software for uni and for work with the samsung 10.1 2014 ed. It is a very stable app and it completely replaced all my several notebooks. The google sync integration would be appreciated, however the export to google drive is possible through the export file to google drive.

content: This is by far the best app for use with the Thinkpad Stylus.  I've tried nearly a dozen others and this does everything I need:  - Nearly perfect palm rejection  - Lasso/edit is easy - Stylus button to erase (genius!)  - Scroll with finger  - Export all pages to pdf  - Backup and Restore feature  - Text insert is not great (but I bought this for handwriting anyway)  - Markup pictures  - Almost no delay or missing strokes.    This app totally replaced my paper notebook for business.
Love this tool, replaces paper in the office. Could be faster on creating and loading documents

It is real fast just like the real thing, def worth the money. I am a grad  student who wanted a more functional note taker. This app has it all aside from the handwriting to text functionality on S Note.  But it's faster and has a better pdf export option and better page layouts.  Quick tip for better performance on the NOTE 10.1 Within settings, first go to input and check "use stylus" then scroll all the way to the bottom and click "filter input setup." Uncheck everything, then check apply Savitzky-Golay filter and set the order to 5. This is my personal favorite, but you might wanna play around with it. Make sure "discard coordinates between Android events" is UNCHECKED.   Now go to Display and scroll halfway down and make sure "use fast temporary rendering" and "use fast page rendering" is checked.   Also make sure force gpu rendering is not on in your developer settings.

This really is one of the best note taking apps on Android right now. However please look into the immersive mode introduced in KitKat, as it can be used to hide the software buttons on the bottom as well as the status screen, which would be very useful. Otherwise a great app!
replyContent: There is an option `hide system bar´ in the app's display settings, section `system and status´ bar that enables `immersive´ mode on devices running Android 4.4 (KITKAT).

I use this app for taking notes in all my classes on a nexus 7  with a simple keyboard case and stylus and I LOVE it. For the classes in which I take handwritten notes, the app is flawless. I can scribble, diagram, copy/paste, highlight, color-code, and even import PDFs to annotate. My one and only qualm is the slight neglect of the typing capability of the app, specifically, the lack of a bulleted list function which would allow me to better organize type-written notes.  I have suggested it to the developer, and he has informed me that his focus is on the handwriting functionality, and that the bulleted list would be a complicated addition to the app. Although I understand his reluctance, this is a hang up for me, and is the only reason why I can't give it 5 stars.
I use it every day taking notes for my classes.

Best note taking app on Android easily
Very useful

I never leave feedback but I want to say thank you for developing this app. I am a writer and needed something just like this to digitize my scribbles and ramblings. Being able to create a PDF version is perfect. I do that, save it to my online storage where I can pick it up on my pc or laptop later. No more being concerned about losing the loose piece of paper (or napkin, envelope...) I grabbed to jot my ideas down. The main reason I bought a tablet is now fulfilled. Thank you! 1-26-14 Great on my Note 3!
Great app! It does exactly what I want. Big thanks to the developers for their prompt responses everytime I needed help!

Having recently moved from the iPad ecosystem, where after three years I used/purchased almost every note taking app available, let me say Lecture Notes is one impressivs app. I must state that I am getting the most from it as as I am running it on a Galaxy 10.1 (2014). However, I have paid for and used Notes+, uPad, Notability ZoomNotes, (all very good) and many others on the iPad and Lecture Notes just has them beat...hands down. My personal preference is to take handwritten notes (hence my move to a Galaxy Note) even though I am fairly proficient at the keyboard. If you prefer this note taking method too then this is the app you have been looking for...bar none in any ecosystem anywhere. The flexibility to fit your unique workflow is there with none of that "my way or the highway mentality". One can tell this developer has really put in some time thinking through many of the ways someone might use this app and has provided a vast amount of configuration. Sure, as always, there is room for improvement and I am sure this developer is focused on just that based on the quality of what has already been done. IMHO this is currently the best app available for handwritten notes...Android or otherwise. Since there is a free trial version, I won't go into any of the functional/configuration details so I suggest...get it, learn how to use it and buy it to support this Android developer!	Great App...get it!
I Love this app! My notes are all organized through color coordination and through the simplicity of this app. I've used it for certain classes and when I want to make a handy list. Again, I love it!
Excellent customer service as well. Keep it up! Suggestion: try to improve the latency on the screen even more.
IT Mayor Use it for taking notes and doing database System UML

At the end of 90 minutes I pressed the stop recording option.   Then when I needed the audio the result only saved the first 30 minutes and 6 seconds.   The audio is a local politician lying in front of many people, so it will happen again. I also have witnesses.  But I would love help getting the full recording.

replyContent: There is an option `auto-rotate´ in the PDF import setup in the app's import settings. If this option is enabled, imported material will be rotated if it makes it fit better on the notebook page. If you disable that option, no rotation will occur.

content: l have tried all of them. But this one is brilliant. l just would recommend modes eg..  1. Advanced -with all settings 2. Basic -pre set  This might Make the app more approachable for beginners

I wish if you can make it auto-backup to dropbox and sync with all devices. I don't like to do it manually everytime I shift device.
replyContent: Even though LN usage of many individual files for storage is ideal for syncing, LN does not directly sync with a cloud service. There are too many cloud services and syncing is better done by the specialized app of your favorite cloud service (or general syncing apps). Just set LN' app directory to a place that you anyway sync.

content: I personally use this app to make my Galaxy Note 10.1 an electronic music stand. Instead of carrying around hundreds of books of sheet music, I can have every single bit of music I own on one device, and most importantly, write on and make notes on the music, which I import from PDF files. Group import of PDFs and background processing would make this app a lot less tedious to get up and running with, but with great customer support from the developer, and features galore, it is a must-buy.
Great notes app

The icing on the cake for this though would be to make it vector based, so i may write in finer detail.  For those who claim it is disorganized or has a daunting list of options, then an apple OS (or Apple app such as notality) is better for you. Android greatly relies on user-tinkering. The customizability of LectureNotes is indeed very powerful and, after spending quite some time familiarizing myself with the options, I have created a powerful writing app that allows me to write quickly and in the aesthetic condition I want. At first, it may seem that this app is lacking when compared to some Apple lecutre apps (like Notality), but after customizing it to my needs, I am able to surpass my friend's Ipad note taking ability. One thing I hope they do, to make it even nicer, is to make it vector-based. Then this app would blow Notality out of the water.    EDIT 14 Jan 2014 : I wish this could import multiple PDF pages (lecturer's slides) into an existing notebook to keep a single classes notes all in one book, as opposed to only importing one page at a time.

I use it on my  note2 and on my note10.1 for handwriting as I am a lefty and also I can drag the heel of my hand and not cause a problem. Also keep help files on it and like the folder and notebooks. :-)
Excellent app. Needs auto back up in pdf format into cloud services though.

I like how organized the app is, but it has its issues. If you change pages within a notebook, the font size goes back to default. changing font size is a guessing game. It doesn't record the size, rather, you have to press smaller or larger and it requires going into the menu for each size change. This means one change per menu navigation. I wish it were easier, maybe based on the line spacing when you create the notebook for the default size, and changes were based on a number system so it was easier to be consistent. If font size were fixed I would rate higher. It's just really annoying for me.
replyContent: You can set the default font properties of the text layer either for all notebooks in the app's handling settings or individually for each notebook in the notebook settings.

content: I use this app daily to take notes during meetings. It can do anything I need and more. Check out the custom shapes, which you can even use as a basis for designing your own.

replyContent: There is a `redo´ icon, it is just hidden by default and need to be enabled in the app's menu settings.

replyContent: You can share individual notebook pages as PNG (which is a better image format for notes due to lossless compression) via the `share´ icon, either in notebook content view or notebook overview. There is no (good) multi-page image format; multiple notebook pages can be shared as PDF in notebook overview.

replyContent: LectureNotes allows for custom paper pattern coded in JavaScript and comes with numerous examples: Select `custom´ as paper pattern, this brings up the JavaScript editor, then select `Use template´ in the main menu, this brings up the example overview. Select one of the examples by clicking on it, then click on `back´ and confirm.
