5 stars. With my Galaxy Note 10.1 2014,  it is a must have app. Much better than Samsungs built in things for the pen I would love it if could add multi window support. I would like to have one window on screen running a browser for example, and this at the same time.
Very intuitive and responsive. For the first time I feel there's a real alternative to pen and paper.
I think the title says it all. I use this app with two devices and I wish they could sync. That's my only issue. Other than that this is pretty perfect.
replyContent: LectureNotes usage of many individual files to store notebook pages is ideal for syncing your notes with a cloud service. To do so, set the app directory to a place on your SD card that gets automatically synced by the syncing app of your favorite cloud service. Doing that on several devices will keep the devices synced as well.

content: I use this app all day,  every day at work. Have done for 12 months. It is the killer application for me and combined with a pen tablet is amazing. This application has made my Note 10.1 an invaluable tool. Great features,  ultra reliable .. great job.

Using a Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1  - sometimes the writing starts erasing immediately after I write something. Then I lose everything I have been working on for the previous 5 minutes. Very frustrating. It's an incredible app otherwise. I will have 32 Grade 7 math students use Lecture notes as their math notebook starting in January. I am in the testing mode and would really like to resolve this serious issue.
replyContent: Very sorry to hear about the problem, please contact me by email so that I can help to resolve the problem.

content: Awesome, but I want the keyboard to automatically popup when I draw a textbox.
I use it frequently for notation, very convenient and easy to use.
best solution for lecture in Galaxy Note. I can lecture and export note in with high-resolution. Thank developer for this wonderful application.
I am a engineering student and I use this everyday.
Goog app
I want to export note file to image, please develop this function.
replyContent: You can share notebook pages as PNG: Enable the `share´ menu in the app's menu settings and select `Share page X´ in the `share´ menu.

content: I really like a LOT about Lecture Notes.  Handwriting capability is superb, and working in a window environment (Galaxy Note 10.1 2014) is an added plus.  There are far too many good things I can say about this app, but there is ONE THING that keeps me from integrating it into my daily workflow.  Text input is very clumsy.  I've had LN for quite a while now, and it doesn't look as if this is important enough to change.  I look forward to the day when I can both enter text (change fonts, color, size etc) as well as cut and paste text easily.  I'll keep hoping and looking.
replyContent: Starting with v2.3.15, LectureNotes allows to use text selection via long-click also for altering text properties.

content: I would have to say this is probably one of the best apps that I have purchased! I was using Samsung's S-Note and am very grateful that I made the switch to Lecture Notes. I have much greater flexibility with my note taking and using the S-Pen then ever before. The Dev for this app is amazing and really does listen to what people say. I made a suggestion and within one update my suggestion was implemented! Now that is impressive! Well worth the install!
This is the best note taking app in the market, far superior to the SNote app.
This is one of the most useful apps I have and I love it.  The feature allowing you to import pdfs and then annotate them is excellent.  I also really love the export to Evernote feature.

A note for Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 Edition - this app is still tops for note-taking on imported pdfs, but the pen-input lag in multiwindow is frustrating. I do have temp fast rendering enabled, which helps - the permanent fast rendering looks too jaggy for me. Hoping for speed improvements, but for now I've found a quick workaround to minimize lag: when things start to slow down after I've opened another window, I exit out of the current notebook and then re-open it - seems to restore the input speed, even when I then switch back and forth between the other open window.  Coming from a thinkpad tablet and now on gnote 10.1, this is a must have for grad school lectures, especially with PDF import/export. Keeps getting better with updates. A note to users (at least on the gnote 10.1) - enabling forced 2D hardware acceleration in developer options under android settings caused a small but noticeable lag in inking - fixed once I disabled the acceleration.

LectureNotes is by far my favorite note-taking app that I have found, but the one thing I feel that is missing that would really make it so much better is being able to sync notes with some form of cloud storage. One thing that makes me really nervous about keeping all my notes on here is if something happens to my tablet and I lose the notes stored locally, then I will have lost all of my notes forever. I know you can export notes to PDF, but having them auto sync to Google Drive or something would be 10x better.
replyContent: Even though LN usage of many individual files for storage is ideal for syncing, LN does not directly sync with a cloud service. There are too many cloud services and syncing is better done by the specialized app of your favorite cloud service (or general syncing apps). Just set LN' app directory to a place that you anyway sync.

content: Great app for note 10.1 2014.
I bought it to edit pdf. Although the app rotate the pdf layouts and it was impossible to fix them.
replyContent: There is a toggle `auto-rotate´ in the app's PDF import settings. With this enabled, LectureNotes rotates the imported PDF pages if this makes it fit better on the page (meaning they can be scaled larger). Disable that toggle and no rotation will occur upon import.

content: Excellent for notes, TONS of settings, it gets better and better, update after update.... in my opinion it's one of the best apps ever made for Android / s-pen hardware.
חפשתי הרבה זמן מש הו דומה וסוף סוף מצאתי...מתאים לכל הדרישות שלי....... תודה על האפליקציה! Just Great!
replyContent: To import multiple pages of a PDF file at once, open your notebook in notebook overview and select `Import PDF file as new pages´ in the main menu. To create a new notebook based on a PDF file, select `Import PDF as new notebook´ in the notebooks board main menu.

content: Combined with a Wacom screen, it's all I've ever wanted from a note taking app.

It would be great if there is an option to automatically export the notes into PDF after saving and automatically overwrite the old PDF versions if any (like a one-sided sync to a certain folder. I use this folder then to sync with dropbox to have all of my notes on the web without having to manually export them to PDF)  EDIT: Thanks for your reply...I did not know that, It's a quite nice workaround and fair enough for me.. I would like to ask if it's possible to lock a certain folder/note with a password...Sometimes one likes to write his thoughts on his note and needs to make sure that nobody stumbles by coincidence into that folder/note. Please make it happen if the option is not there :-)
replyContent: There is a semi-automatic PDF export: Select `Export notebooks board to PDF´  (or `Export folder to PDF´) and choose `modified notebooks only´ in the dialog, then only notebooks that have been touched since their last export to PDF will be exported.

content: Very nice application,  get it
I use this app to lecture in class. I has help me stay on point. This is a great application. It works well on Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 2014.
Best app ever!
Make sure to check LectureVideo too. It's an extension to the app which allows you to record videos as you write. Great for making video lectures .
I use this app on a daily basis, and it hasn't let me down yet! I take notes in it , I use it for calculatons and I use it just for fun.
The  best note taking app there is in the android market.
replyContent: Use a larger paper size; when you create a new notebook, click on the `?´ aside of `paper size´, then LectureNotes gives recommendations.

content: Great App
Great app, particularly for galaxy note
Please make a closeup box the way notes plus has on iOS.would make this app perfect
replyContent: This input method is called `input zone´ in LectureNotes.

content: PDF importing is poorly documented, I had to visit a third party site to realize that the problem was the lack of support for the default file manager (Had to download astro). Frankly I'm disappointed that it took so long to achieve the purpose of the app. currently waiting for my PDF file to process to see if it works.but so far, I'm not amused by this app.
Brilliant and full of options, great dev support. Maybe could use a less intimidating mode, but truthfully I wouldn't want it any other way.

Thanks to this app, I no longer need to care extra pencils, pens or note pads. Works amazing.   One function though that I would love to see, unless I missed it somewhere, is the ability to back up everything in the app, all notes and folders. For future proofing, like in a year or two when I get a new tablet, would love to just be able to export everything as one file from the old tablet and import it as one file on the new tablet and just have it like nothing changed, all notes and folders are exactly the same.
Best and most inclusive for Turkey professional note taking and meeting

Very good app . Only thing missing that I have with S-Note is the ability to transform hand written notes to text.  That would give it a extra star for me. Also would love to be able to link notes together.  Really miss DayNotez.

Good work developers. However pl include auto shape recognizition for underlining and highlighting as in S Note. Also include horizontal scrolling of notebook pages, currently it is only vertical scrolling.

This is the best app I have found for taking handwritten notes for android. Ive been using it for all my classes this semester. I like that I can export specific notebooks to pdf so I can view them on my desktop. An autobackup to one of the many cloud sevices feature would be appreciated since I tend to forget to backup my notebooks for a week or more on average. Also, adding typed text to a note feels a bit clumsy at times. Overall a good app, and I appreciate that it is in a constant cycle of improvements to make it better.
Love it!
Excellent

So I messaged the app developer to let them know that the autocorrect for AOSP / Google keyboard doesn't work, and essentially the reply I get back is because the keyboard breaks the app. Further more the Dev also suggests that I should use a different keyboard. That's great and all but for whatever reason SwiftKey seems to type fine everywhere else but with this app, in Lecture Notes it seems to want me to type 1 letter per second, it's not helpful to do that when you need to type at 80 wpm for lecture.

This is an outstanding app. I use it with my Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1. It is my main choice for annotating pdf files and for creating notes. The ability to save files as pdf is also great.  If I could add a request it would be to allow the recording of audio while you are writing notes in a live way. This would increase the usefullness for teaching.
The app is really nice and trully customizable with lots of features. Now I have nothing else to wish for! :)  Much better than the S Note app.
I no longer use real notebooks solely because of this app.
Awesome work man. This app is fantastic!
replyContent: I am sorry to hear about the problem, please contact me by email.

content: I prefer this one to Handrite PRO for its features.
I just love it.

I use this all the time now in place of my old spiral bound note book. I have the Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 so the stylus makes it almost the same as writing on paper. The great thing about Lecture Notes is the ability to save in a variety of formats and email those notes. Great productivity tool.

Best app on Android market for note taking. I started with free trial then eventually upgraded to paid version. We'll worth the few dollars. I'm a PhD student and wanted an easy way to take notes at lectures, annotate pdfs, etc.
Outstanding!
Apparently has all the features you could want and it is highly customizable. Developer is quick to respond to questions and very polite and helpful.
Highly customizable, smooth and with great support for active stylus. The best note taking app out there!

I came to Android from iOS and have been looking for something to replace GoodNotes, my favorite iOS app. LectureNotes is pretty close, and in fact it offers much more customization. What put me off for a while was the design, which looks way too basic. I would love to see a prettier user interfase and more user-friendly settings. As to the features, my main target use will be as a tablet-whiteboard when teaching, with my Galaxy Note 10.1 connected wirelessly to a projector, and it looks like once I've found all the right settings, things will work pretty well.

By far, the best S-Pen note-taking app I've found. I use it daily during meetings, capturing white board images and snapshots, then annotating and taking hand written notes. Easier to organize and use for daily business than S-Note. With LectureNotes, I've been able to quit hauling multiple notebooks on cross-country trips, and I've always got all my notes with me now.  The dev was very responsive in explaining how to adjust images, solving the last of my issues. Very flexible, and highly configurable, allowing you to get the exact sort of look and feel you want. It's not trivial, but very very powerful.   If you want options, this is your choice.
replyContent: Many thanks for revising your review.

content: Can't recommend this more for the galaxy note 10.1. Copying options far superior to stock s note. Even adapts sensitivity of s pen stylus, and indexes pages with keywords. The best app for making notes, best purchase I've made on the Play Store so far.
Very advanced

I've always wanted to be able to replace all of my notebooks with a single app on my tablet.  I've wanted something that will allow me to take notes on top of PowerPoint charts, PDFs, and anything else that might be discussed at a meeting or in a lecture.  This App, paired with the S-pen on my Galaxy Note 10.1, has finally allowed me to do that.  From PowerPoint on my PC, I can print to Google Cloud Print, then select my tablet as the printer.  As long as I have this App opened to the correct page I can then add the printed charts to the end of the current notebook as new pages and then take all the notes I want on them.  One minor annoyances: When opening pdfs with LectureNotes, you have to have the App opened in "Notebook Overview" or else it will just ask you which page you want to add instead of adding all of them.  I wish it would give you the option to add all of the pages from within a notebook too.  Overall, I like this App more than Snote, but It would be really useful if this app could do handwriting recognition like Snote.  That's the one feature that I miss.

On 3 occasions over the last two months, while using Lecture Notes, I lost the ability to navigate my Samsung Galaxy Note 8 using capacitive or finger touch, even outside the Notebook Board; although I can still navigate using the s-pen stylus. When this happens I restart the tablet, and I am able to once more use capacitive or stylus touch in all the apps including Lecture Notes. However, the loss of capacitive touch happened only when I use Lecture Notes. Can the app developer help me with this issue?
replyContent: LectureNotes cannot disable finger (capacitive) input outside the app. The problem sounds more like a hardware issue, probably the same behavior would occur if you used the S-pen in the same amount that you use it in LectureNotes.

content: After the update , my spen is not working properly . The feedback is not continuos. It just stops in the middle , when im writing. Please fix I dont want to go back to s note. Its horrible please please fix

This is, BY FAR, the best note-taking app I’ve ever used.  I have tried well over 50 different apps on Android and iOS, and nothing even comes close.    With the S-Pen, taking notes is about 95% the same as writing with a pen and paper.    Awesome customization from folders to book covers to paper color/pattern/lines.  You are even able to import high quality PDF’s for annotating/highlighting.    The only thing that is missing is the ability to add expandable sticky notes to notes/PDF’s while annotating.    But I’d give this more stars if I could.  Main reason I’m sticking with my 2014 Note 10.1.    Thanks, Acadoid!!
1st problem, cannot recrop the image imported. 2nd problem, export resolution very low for the pen I use. 3rd problem, cannot share video record easily to other lecture notes user
replyContent: You can crop imported material prior to insertion by long-clicking and adjusting the boundaries; after insertion, you need to use the cutter tool.

content: This is a great app for note taking. I feel it works better than S note. Lecture Notes gives you much more settings than S Note on page sizes, covers, and pretty much anything else it has to offer. The app is also compatible with the multitasking option offered on the galaxy note 10.1 2014 edition. The developers are always updating the app with good, meaningful updates. This is a great app

I spent a long time debating whether to purchase this or not. I was using Samsung's S Note and this beats it on every level once you take the time to play with it and go through some of the help features.   Possible improvement is the app icon and notebooks board, they are very bland.

Highly recommend. The support is excellent and the application is simply without an equal. Well worth the money.  The only thing I would point out is that there are so many options that it can seem a bit overwhelming at first. But play around with it for a few days and you realise that not only is it pretty intuitive, but all those options really let you use the app the way you want to. Just brilliant.
Close to fluid
I use this all the time. Great work guys
Just have a look at the recent changes.

Have had the 2012 glaxaxy note 10.1, note 2 and  on the 2014 galaxy 10.1... Though Samsung has made a big update to the s pen app this time around,  I am back to lecture notes...  After a week.   One request,  please let someone design a new icon for the app.  It's really bad.   :)
I bought the galaxy note 10.1 (2014 edition) and the notes app sucks! This app transformed my tablet into the best tablet eVER. THANKS!!!!
Lots of customizations and works perfectly with the s-pen. The interface feels a bit dated and can seem complex for some given the wide ange of settings but the app itself works perfectly.
I love this app. I have recommended it and got a lot of people to buy it. :)
replyContent: Many thanks for revising your review.

content: Wonderful app

This app has been wonderful for me to tske notes in class. Unparalleled in the amount of tools available.  Recently  I had to replace my tablet, so now I have a new nexus 7, which seems to have some touch issues. The developer responded to my concerns and offered to look into ways to accommodate these issues.  Overall really appreciate this app and support!
replyContent: This is a hardware issue, there have been numerous reports in various user groups about `ghost´ input on this device. This `ghost´ input causes LectureNotes to `see´ a two-fingers-gesture instead of your writing.

content: Even greater configurability of hot keys would make it awesome.

Very useful app. Nearly Notability for android (and in some ways better). Has some advantages over S note (can store to extSD). I'd like text wrapping but this is Very Complex to Implement. Good job dev. look forward to Updates
This app helps me and my galaxy note 10.1 lead an almost paper-free life.  And I'm a lawyer! We in invented waste of paper!
Use it all of the time.  Great app.
I have used lecture notes a lot. It works great.  It REALLY needs a way to add hyperlinks.
Awesome
Great app, a lifesaver really!
Constant updates. Tweak any aspect of the app to your exact preference. Fastest rendering engine of any handwriting app I have used

I have tried all the notetaking apps (quill, papyrus, s-note) and for sheer functionality, this is the best. Well worth the premium version. Also strongly recommend the pdf rendering plugin - for handwritten annotation of pdfs, this works much smoother than acrobat reader.

I've been using this for a year now. I have tried a number of other apps, this is by far the best. The menu structure is a bit chaotic, however once you get through initial configuration the application runs smooth and serves the purpose of taking notes with a pen extremely well. The pen experience is much better then with Samsung's built in S Note on Galaxy Note.

I bought the note 10.1 because of photoshop...I bought my Note 8 and Note 3 because of this application.  Wish list of features...launch the camera app for direct import to the notebook and more importantly provide a Samsung Knox version so I can take notes in a secure container...A samsung gear version would also be nice.
replyContent: To directly import from camera, select `camera´ in the image import setup in the app's image import settings, or enable the `photo camera´ icon the app's menu settings.

content: Exactly what I was looking for to take notes in class.  I love being able to import PDFs and adding notes to them.  Totally will stop bringing binders to school.  Highly recommend it. It's great that they do a triak version before you decide to buy it.  Totally worth it.
I am using this app for business notes in meetings. It works great. Created my own template based on our handwritten pads. Love it.
Awesome

This is easily the best note taking app out there. It may, initially, be hard to see why people think so highly of a note taking app and I will tell you why. This app easily trumps all others on options alone. It takes a little time to really figure out what kind of Notebooks, writing styles, and gestures / quick keys you want; but the fact that you have so much flexibility is why this app is the best.   That Said, the only thing I miss from s-note is the search wolfram alpha button. It is incredibly useful
Good app!
Totally recommended! Buy without think too much xD  Only feature missing: Cloud Sync!
There are a lot of features, though I am not able to find the place to start a recording.  I have installed the full version of notes and recordings and looked eveywhere!  How do I do it?
Best features, responsive developer.  Use it to take notes during class with my adjonit pro stylus and it functions as if it is a real note book, only better!
Tried several differnet ones as I dont like S Note. Features and functionality of this are a 5 in my book.
Any chance of a widget like s note or something like a shelf on home screen where you can go straight to notes. Also, it'll be really good if 2 notes can be opened at the same time. Thanks

Great app, useful for lectures. Just wondering how I can set it to automatically backup files to notebooks every x days or something incase I end up losing data due to hardware or software failure? Can't seem to find an automatic backup setting, otherwise 5*.
replyContent: There is a manual but no automatic backup. To be on the safe side, I recommend to sync your notes with your favorite cloud service (or your private server) and pull regular backups there.

content: Amazing, great for lectures. Ashlee me to go paperless.
This application is very helpful and handy to use

I've been using this for the past two days, and it's so customizable and so useful that I'm giving it 5 stars. I'm extremely happy with this program. Thank you so much for your hard work on this, developer.
Nearly no complains at all. Highly recommended

I use a PP presentation which was converted to PDF and imported to LectureNotes, then LectureNotes environment is projected on screen by classroom projector. Sometimes I do need some pointer to point out something on the screen without leaving ink mark. Something like an arrow pointer which appears during original PP presentation would be highly appreciated.
replyContent: You can use the hover (on devices with active stylus) or a mouse connected by Bluetooth (which will result in an arrow on the display that fades when not being used) for that.

content: One of the best
The best note taking app once figured out!
I would like to see a review option that disables writing and makes an easy to read view. I want to be able to review notebooks quickly and easily that are 70+ pages.

Great for taking all kinds of notes on pics, pdfs, etc. Quick feedback from developer. Paid full version and enjoy it much. Closest thing to NotesPlus on the iPad. Just about anything is possible. Thanks!
replyContent: After installation of PDFView, you need to start LectureNotes once to make it recognize PDFView. Afterwards, LectureNotes should show up as PDF viewer/receiver.

content: Amazing software that I pan to use for note-taking in medical school.

This is the best app for any tablet with pen device. It's simple as a notebook.   Will be perfect IF:  1. possibility to import images from the clipboard, as S Notes 2. possibility to disable menu & back buttons 3. ability to change pen with button   Besides this, is the best app for taking notes for any student /academic.  The best feature is the possibility to import a PDF and add notes, without missing the quality of the PDF. Kudos to the developer!  Edited to FIVE stars after the quick answer from the developer, double kudos to him/her!
replyContent: 1. Select `non-standard clipboard´ in the `cutter´ menu. 2. Select `hide action bar´ in the menu at the app's launcher icon and enable `disable back key´ in the app's display settings. 3. Enable `use stylus button´ in the app's input settings and set the tool in the stylus button setup in the app's handling settings.

content: Works really well, lots of settings highly recommended.

Great App for taking notes on Galaxy Note 10.1. However after the update I seem to have trouble using the zoom bar with my fingers while writing with the pen. It was smooth before the update. Any setting that can be altered to change this?
replyContent: You can zoom and scroll using two-fingers-gestures in `hand´ mode, or, if you enable `use stylus´ and the two-fingers-gestures, in all modes.

content: Great
It is thr best app to take lecture's note. All my mathmatic's stuff are in this app.  I hope you will add arabic language.
The user interface is to dull and simple.. And a nice widget for memos would be grand, other then that great features and options
Let's just say that's the best note taking app for note 10.1

Love this app. I use it everyday at college, and its integration and sharing features are outstanding, I can't fault this in any way! I love it.  Please in future updates add more shape features, like a table, or checklist! Thanks for making this app.
Great app. The import PDF is awesome. Makes work easier.
The best apps that suits my s note 10.1.

Note 10.1.  This app is easily the best note taking app for my needs.  It runs well and is highly customizable.  Only negative I have is the difficulty (impossibility?) of syncing my notebooks as a pdf with Google drive.  Would be sweet if I could find a way to do that.
replyContent: You can do that using the Google Drive app to sync the LectureNotes' app directory with your Google Drive account.

content: My hardest class last year had me taking handouts and notes at rapid-fire pace while constantly having to find older notes to understand newer ones. By photographing the handouts, I not only kept those in order (and un-loseable), but made taking notes directly on them far easier. LectureRecordings is a great addition and you'd be a fool to not use it. The only issue keeping my rating at 4 stars is that this app is really slow at accepting input from a BT keyboard, which results in constant errors that I don't see in other apps (mostly it switches the order of characters and spaces, so the last letter of a word gets spaced and becomes the first letter of the next word). It's more pronounced when recording audio, but is always present.

This app is so customizable it will be perfect for your workflow, no matter how it is. Simply great! I would love some features to help me align mathematical expressions. They have always looked pretty ugly.
The best I have seen
The best pen application. Buy It. You won't regret.

This app has greatly streamlined my college notes. I love the flexibility compared to S-Note. Also the customizability of the pressure sensitivity is outstanding; my personalized settings are perfectly tailored to my handwriting style. The constant updates show the dev is committed and makes it totally worthwhile.
Use it for class and love it. No more 50 lb backpack filled with notes. Highly customizable options. Indexing makes studying easier.

Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1  In many ways it's much more convenient and easy to use than Samsung S Pen application despite not being as functional as the latter one''.  Lookiny forward to seeIng more new interesting features.
Use it all the time

I am a full time student, this app works well for any student with a tablet. I have digital copies of my text books as well, combining screen shots of the pages and using this app to take notes is amazing. I also use the audio recording expansion of this app to combine handwritten notes with lectures.
Great!
A great apps help me in lectures and other jotting down notes.

Probably on of the best apps for note taking but certain features need improved	For the most part I really like the features on this app, there are however a few things that erk me about it.  1. The importing PDF function is slow and clunky. 2. There should be better functionality for typing notes, like being able to draw a text box, type and have the text automatically adjust in size. 3. Spell check for typed notes!

Tired of the quirkyness and lack of features in S-Note, I went on a quest for a replacement.  This app blew me away with pen options like offset,  thickness, page layers, import/export, menu customization, switchable zoom mode, adjustable paper resolution, (565x800 is a nice point between responiveness and readability on my samsung note 1 phone).  It takes awhile to get everything adjusted to maximum sweetness, but well worth the effort.  My favorite android app, period.  Easily worth more than it costs!

I really like this app, it's good stuff. Has a few kinks, might be my fault, not sure. Just with importing/exporting. But I love all the customization options you have. It's unreal.  I was wondering though, when you want to put text in your stuff instead of writing with a stylus, is there no way to just simply tap where you want to start typing or make a text box that you can drag around? When I go to text it just uses the entire page, and I have to press enter and space over and over again until I get where I want.                                                                   EDIT:          In response to YOUR response:  Found it! And it's awesome.  5 stars for you!
replyContent: Many thanks for revising your review.

content: Ever easy to use

I am using the Samsung Note 10.1 with the S pen stylus. Absolutely amazing app for students who are looking to go paperless and save space. I have no need for exercise books anymore as I can have them all on one app and make each virtual pad look unique. Tonnes of great features. Only thing i'd improve is the default location of pdf export storage as It took a while to find.  If you're struggling to decide whether you want to buy it or not just download the trial version like I did. Happy studying.
Just best! Best app in the market! Countless functions are there!

This app is great, I use it all the time at uni. One feature I enjoy is the ability to import pdf documents, I import my lecture notes and annotate them in another layer.  I previously said in my reviw that there was no highlighter, I was wrong - for the curious, edit the custom pens.
EDIT: Just wish there was a SIMPLER way to sync notes across devices within the lecture notes app itself and not having to use another app in combination.
replyContent: Even though LN usage of many individual files to store notebook pages is ideal for syncing, LN does not directly sync devices, but this can be achieved by syncing the app directory on each device with a cloud service, this will automatically sync the devices. A large fraction of users has in fact multiple devices and does syncing in this way.

content: Really cool tabbed notebook app!
Cant import pdf files. It seems it is not alowed to do that anymore. Its the only reason i have bought it, and now it dosent work.
replyContent: You need to install PDFView to be able import PDF. After installation (and restarting LectureNotes), additional menu entries will be available and the settings will be accessible.

content: Everything works well. Stylus detection on my samsung galaxy 10.1 is perfect. I just bought the full version today. Used it in class without any issues or slowdowns. Very easy to understand and find the settings you want.  I would love to see a highlighter and shapes tool. Also perhaps a way to auto add the date to the end of my noteboos titles. The current option just replaces the name with the date. Finally i would like to be able to add a header of each page in a notebook with date and title just for ocd reasons.   Otherwise amazing app. Great buy   Update: I have been using this app for almost a year now and it is still wonderful. There are so many little features here and there that really help. I really like the ability to draw shapes. It really helps keep my notes stay neat.   I would just say that the app lacks some usability. A lot of the features are hidden and took me a long time to discover they existed. Perhaps a tutorial system of some sort would help your users better understand the app.   I would also really appreciate a table making function of some sort. Currently I just draw multiple squares but itd be nicer to have a table feature for engineering based notes.
Worth every cent!

Worth every penny!  If you wanna have a greener environment, go for this app..save paper, save trees... This app has more functionality than just writing... I wish there could have been a web functionality through which we can access the notes on web...
Must have for a progressive college student
Great if you have a tablet & attend college. You can import pdf and write on it, not to mention you can also edit it as well. I recommend this to take notes also.

You know how on ever note when your typing it has this amazing thing where you can put bullet points everytime you press enter Also when you push tab it makes another colum Well if this could do that it would be number 1 Hopfully you guys can add that Cuz that is very important and honestly the only thing I need this semester
Great app for note taking
Facil de usar y con muchascaracteristicas q la hacen veloz para tomar notas. Un aplicacion excelente.
once you get going, this app is limitless. I need some more manuals or explanaition for lots of the functions though.
The absolute best of the ink note taking apps. It has a massive feature set and the developer is constantly improving the program.
Great application...could be better if the speed of importing PDF is faster:P

Absolutely amazing program! Works like a charm and is my personal favorite note taking app for the note 10.1! With this app I have gone completely paperless for school! Works best with digitized stylus like the note has, but still very good even without (used on previous tablet)   Suggestions 1. Allow backups, imports, and exports to/from the SD card.  2. Cloud sync across devices would be a very nice!   3. Preview window of lines or grid for notebook should show actual size not %  Great app!
Why cant i only import a picture? That takes to much time and i have to be switching apps! I want to be able to take a picture from the same app!
replyContent: Set the image source to `camera´ in the app's import settings to directly import from camera.

content: Wish I would have had this app and tablet when I started school 4 years ago....not 2 semesters before graduation

Love this application much better than the note program that came with my galaxy note 2
Best for taking notes

My initial reaction to this app was that it wasn't quite as easy to use as others on the store. I stuck with it and am so glad I did. After a little getting used to it,  this is far more functional than any other, and if you have a galaxy note it's a complete game changer.
Great!
Great for handwritten notes. Beats S-Note and Papyrus in terms of utility and usability.
its great in all it's functionality. I just need one more feature: possibility to move the text window wherever I want in the page.  Is there a setting for it that I have missed?  Thank you.

Can you please extend the safe zone to the corners of the page? Is there a way to have it where you can write anywhere and have the text resize in sequence like some of the other handwriting apps? And could we add titles or tags to the notes? Oh, and if we could record and write at the same time? And maybe have the written text highlight with playback like on microsoft onenote? Update: the app is perfect
replyContent: The `safe zone´ can be adjusted using two-fingers gestures. This input method is called `input zone´. You can attach keywords to pages. You can record audio while taking notes using LectureRecordings if you start audio recording in LectureNotes. You can record videos while taking notes with the LectureVideos extension.

content: While it doesn't automatically sync to the cloud, you can upload it to dropbox and pull down on another device. You just have to remember to do it.
Very convenient and highly customizable
This is a simple app that delivers on every promise. No need for paper anymore.
Nice, very nice
Great
It's a must have for tablet owners with a stylus. My desk is more "paperless" now!
Had an issue with zooming in on the app. The developer was quick and responsive to fix the issue
Very good
Great app for taking notes
Best note taking app for school I have come across.  It has completely replaced the need for pen and paper and even a highlighter. Worth every penny!

This is by far the best note taking app out of the four or five I tried out. I really love this app! I want to give props to the developer for making a trial version of this app so I could test it before I bought it. Not all of the handwriting/notes apps have this and I found it extremely helpful. The developer is also responsive to emails! I would recommend this app to anyone who is serious about writing long hand frequently for any reason: school, work, pleasure, etc. It does take some adjustment and time getting used to if you have not written on a tablet before, and it also requires some tinkering to optimize it for your personal use.   I would not recommend this app for those who just want to play with writing on a screen. It requires set up and dedication to make it your own. S Note or similar would be better suited to recreational use.   I 100% recommend anyone interested in this app to download the trial first and give it a go.   I tested this app on my galaxy note 10.1. All functions perform wonderfully with new updates bringing improvements.
Best app for note taking
Makes Uni so much easier
As a university student I find this app is very useful in my day to day activites !
זו אפליקציה מאוד מאפשרת לבעלי סטילוס. הרצאות שלמות סיכמתי בדפים אלה. מעולה.

Lecture Notes is an amazing app with a dev who's just as awesome! Seriously. The dev is responsive to questions (and suggestions) and each update brings so many improvements that I could gush about all day!  The main thing I'd like to see now is better PDF handling for annotations and whatnot. And maybe a floating toolbox for the layers tab, like the expandable/shrinkable pencil toolbox. The keyboard isn't as intuitive as other apps but I only use it for handwritten notes anyway.  Lecture Notes isn't perfect, but it's packed with so many customizable features. This is a must-have app for those who want to take digital notes that mimic traditional pen and paper. It's the best $4 I ever spent!

It took me under 2 weeks to get used to writing on a screen. I kept notes for my engineering classes throughout the year, and I must say I was really satisfied. Keep up the good work.  Implementing a ruler for straight lines would help in making geometric figures.
replyContent: There are drawing tools such as line, rectangle, etc. You can access them either via the pencil toolbox (`Show pencil toolbox´ in the `pencil´ menu) or the drawing tools menu (has to be enabled in the app's menu settings).

content: Best Note Taking App for Android

My first tablet experience (Galaxy Note 10.1) was a bit of a downer with apps. There is not too many I would rate higher then 3 due to lack of functionality and imagination. I do not mind paying for an app if it is well thought out and functional. I can not even find nice web browser. Dolphin is likely the nicest, but it is not 5 star. I tried six of them. This all changed with LectureNotes. First app I could say “wow this is different”. Keep up the good work.
Note taking during meetings couldn't be simpler.
The only complaint I have is no cloud support
Great

I purchased lecture notes about 6 months ago and l haven't had any cause for regret. I do however have an inquiry, is it possible to put a password on a notebook or folder? I have a few nosy friends. Still gave it a five though. Great app!

I like yo be able to be as paperless as possible amd not have to carry around notebooks everywhere.  This app is great for just about anything. I use it on a galaxy note tablet and it works great and helps keep me organized.
Excellent, best note taking app by far

I downloaded this app the first week of med school,  and so far,  so good! It's easy to download my lecture notes and really cuts down on the back strain of hauling around 40 lb of paper notes.  Only con right now is I'm struggling to find an easy way to back up my notes online and access them on a computer,  in case anything happens to my tablet...
replyContent: LectureNotes has a `Backup/Restore notebooks board´ (and `Backup/Restore folder´) functionality, so that you easily backup/restore your notes. An alternative is to sync the LectureNotes' app directory with your favorite cloud service.

content: This app is the BEST i have ever bought. It probably works amazingly due to the Galaxy Note 10.1.   I use this during school all the time and I'm able to keep up with professors while they lecture as well as create my own notes with so many options making them very useful. I've already had tons of friends asking me about it and wanting the same thing. Unfortunately for them, their systems dont have the capability to run without issues unlike the Note 10.1 =D
Love the app.  Keep working on palm rejection.
Great Note Taking App. Would love Drop box Syncing
Simple easy to use, better than evernote. The predict text doesn't replace the word you have to choose it. If you don't catch it you end up with multiple grammatical and spelling errors.
I suggest adding a functionality to be able to position a selected page to the right or to the left from the current page. This is needed if I want to see some formula from the other page

I bought this app solely for its PDF functionality. Unfortunately, the PDF plugin turns all of the pages into images so that I can't edit any of the text or highlight words or anything. Additionally, when I export my notes as PDF, everything is merged into images so that the file sizes are 5x bigger and I can't search or copy any previously searchable text. In all my years of schooling (I'm currently in med school) I've always had my lecture slides provided as PDFs. If you want to make an app named LectureNotes, please get better PDF funcionality. I don't need things like sticky notes or shapes and whatnot but being able to search my notes in manageable file sizes would be invaluable to me.  As it stands, this is still the only app with PDF support that also supports disabling finger input AND allowing pen sensitivity.
Best app ever
This app satisfies my spen needs on my galaxy 10.1... The vast number of options makes it super easy for me to configure the app just how I want it.
Clearly developed by someone who understands how this type of app should work -tons of ways to customize so it fits with your preferred style.
Excellent pdf export/import functionality,  but still a work in progress.  Worth the money, and you financial support!
Love it for taking notes in my engineering courses! It has been extremely helpful
Its would be great if you can view more pages instead of just the two in focus ones when annotating your notes.
replyContent: If your device has sufficient RAM, enable `use larger page cache´ in the app's storage settings.

content: Awesome
It's perfect

This app was one I had been searching for for a long time. It is a great note taking app with super customizability. My only complaint is that importing PDFs can be slow. But a wonderful app for students!

This is a great app for college. You can write your notes including photos and imported graphics. Best part is since college classes build on previous ones you can have all of them readily available!!!
great way to annotate papers
I use it to drop down ideas and design notes. It would be perfect if I could sync all my notes to google drive within the app.
love this app except it does not allow me a more realistic experience in page flipping.

I am a 3rd year engineering student, so taking notes on anything but paper is arduous and slow since most of my classes involve lots of math. I got the galaxy note 10.1 and this app and the two together have been absolutely wonderful. Lecture notes will let you make it so the only input that the screen will take is the stylus. SO NO ACCIDENTAL WRITING FROM MY HAND EVER HAPPENS. My only wish is that I could set it up so the note books automatically saved to dropbox. But overall I have been extremely happy with this combo and would certainly recommend it to other engineering/math majors looking to take electronic notes.
Great!

I love the way you can record, while taking notes (if you have paid for LectureRecordings). The option to autoscroll when I am writing notes, saves me a lot of time. Writes smoothly even with a cheap stylus. Palm rejection works great. I like being able to save to PDF with or without the notebook patterns, if you have any. Unlike other apps where you are locked in to a certain number of notebook paper patterns, the developer allows the use of javascripts, and provides examples. You can create paper patterns composed of lines, squares, triangles, or anything you want just by using the simple JS. This app is very low on permissions. Just needs sd card access to save files. Features I would add: Need color numbers on the color wheel, and the ability to move or resize shapes when you initially add them. Save to cloud would be good too.
Excellent App for Note 8 + stylus.
Good product
1 Like this note taking  app. itIs very helpful

Until now the best

Using the Samsung Galaxy Note 8's S pen. Very realistic display that's easy to customize, organize notes, even copy and paste jpegs, odds, etc. Lecture Notes is one of the Android Play Store's best kept secrets!

Not just great for note taking but it's amazing for artwork too.  Some things that would be great to add though,  -zoom using volume rocker -easier way to see the colour of a very low alpha pen (perhaps a colored border around the pen in the quick menu) -eye dropper or ability to transfer one custom pens settings to another one. -ability to manually enter hex values for colour (or rgb values)
replyContent: To enter colors as RGB instead of the default color picker, enable `select colors as RGB´ in the app's handling settings. If you click on the view showing the custom pencil in the custom pencil settings, you cycle through all standard and custom pencils, which allows to transfer (duplicate) pencils.

content: Now if only Microsoft could incorporate the power and customizability of this program into its Onenote Android app.    Please add a "delete page" button option in the menu settings.
replyContent: To erase the content of a page, use the `clear page´ items in the `eraser´ menu; to remove a page from the notebook, use the `delete page´ item in the `hand´ menu.

content: Great writing app! Seems like the only good writing app on android.

Way easier app to write your notes on and organize them,unlike S note. with lecture notes you can not only Select the type of paper to write on but you can also change the line spacing, Making it college ruled or different.

In some other apps you can always double tap the text box or pic, after selecting the related button, and edit, move, recize, rotate, etc.
replyContent: Cut, copy, and paste text work in the text layer and in the text drawing tool following Android standard, i.e. long-click to activate the context menus.

I've got it to the point where it's invaluable for me and am happy to have paid for this app. I tried a few other apps and couldn't quite get them to the point where they worked well for what I needed. replyContent: You can zoom using two-fingers-gestures in `hand´ mode and, if enabled in the app's input settings, in all other modes as well.

replyContent: To share the PDF file from the Dropbox app to LectureNotes for import should actually work.

content: Excellent note taking app.  Very customisable, which means it may take a bit of time to learn - but well worth it.

replyContent: One can set images as notebook and folder covers with the latest version v2.3.7.

content: Just perfect for tablets with a pen

This is a GR8 application and works better than S Note on your Samsung Devices!!!!  The notes are more clear and easy to share with many applications.  I use it with Evernote which is the best coupling.   I have never lost a note like I have in S Note.  I highly recommend Lecture Notes for Business!!!!
Love it

Snote has potential, but was so unreliable and glitchy I just couldn't use it. If it wasn't one thing, it was another with Snote. Lecture notes is so rock solid! It has a lot of options, but if you go through them when you first open it and take your time you can set this app up to be incredibly simple yet powerful. There is a learning curve so if your a student, don't buy this if your crunched for time; wait until you have a few days to set it up and feel it out. Dual screen on a note 10.1, the palm guard has worked great, and dropbox export... In fact, many different options for exporting. There are some geometry things like lines and ovals. Nothing like Snotes shape recognition but at this point I'm not going to nit pick. Lecture notes is reliable enough that I make due. Really, it doesn't slow me down. It's not as flashy as Snote with math function look ups and stuff, but it does it's job extremely well. Samsung should approach this developer and just buy it and trash Snote, or at least get this Dev on board. Samsung obviously can't figure it out.

I don't often take the time to review apps, but I feel compelled to share my enthusiasm. I use this daily for note taking at work. The so-called premium suite on the galaxy note is geared towards cutsie casual use and completely unsuitable for business. Not the case here. This is designed for serious professional use and it is the best app out there hands down. Fast, powerful features, fluid intuitive UI, stable. Did I mention fast? Excellent! Keep it light! Close to perfection on the galaxy note.
Does everything it promises,  and does it well. Great customer support.
An excellent piece of software which transforms the Samsung note 10.1 into an incredibly useful piece of kit. The best app I've bought by far.

Gotta admit, the flexibility of this app is highly useful. Includes musical staff paper! Would be nice to have font automatically adjust in size and then fit within the lines, or at least have the ability to do it manually. You can only adjust font size incrementally (smaller or larger, with no ability to jump to a specific size), but the text doesn't adjust alignment, so the text ends up overlapping the lines of the paper. Maybe also including the ability to select a different font? But in spite of these limitations, still a very solid app for note taking and fast designing.

Hi, I am not able to import PDF files in the APP. I haVe Es File Explorer but I don't have the option to import a PDF file. Could this be because I had the trial version before the paid?
replyContent: You need to install the free help app PDFView. Afterwards, there will be additional menu items and the PDF import settings will be accessible.
