Thanks so much for your Lecture notes app. When I bought my Note 10.1, it was far note taking, mind maps, composing by writing (my brain works better with a pen/stylus than with a keyboard. And Lecture Notes is so easy to use. It is brilliant!

userName: จตุรพิธ ชมพูนุท
content: อยากให้มี template สำหรับลง บ/ช และนัดหมายประจำวัน more templates eg. Daily journal and appointment are appreciated.

I knew this would be a useful app when I purchased it, but it's proven to be even more than I anticipated.  Beyond the live note-taking functionality, I use this app to help me organize...well, basically, anything and everything....From Artistic inspirations to Music ideas to Gift ideas to Travel plans to Shopping Wishlists to Recipes to Room arrangemnts...you name it!  Love that you can not only import images, but also add layers so you can make notes over the image that can later be updated without altering the image itself. Super convenient!  Also love the graph paper option in addition to the standard lined or unlined.  Makes floor layout/furniture placement notes so much quicker and cleaner.  ★Suggestion for new Paper style:  Staff Lines for Music Notation!  For me, that would move this from a 5 star app to a 10 star app!  Devs, I barely scratched the surface on all the excellent features of this app, but fantastic job!  Love it. Love it. Love it.
replyContent: There are single and double staff pattern available as custom paper pattern examples: Select `custom´ as paper pattern, this brings up the editor; select `Use template´, this brings up the overview; scroll down, staff lines are the sixth and fifth from the bottom; click to select, this brings you back to the editor; click on `back´ and confirm.

content: Brilliant app! My only wish would be to have a similar ink style as something like Sketchbook, where the ink is more fluid and life like.  In Lecture Notes them are always little jaggies instead of lighter pen marks (not sure if it takes advantage of pressure sensitive tablets like the Note).  Otherwise an excellent app!
replyContent: Some Note 10.1 devices display these `jaggies´; try to enable the pressure filter in the app's input settings with a threshold of 5% or so, this should remove them. Pencils can be made pressure sensitive.

content: An excellent app for college work , very customizable and works like it should withe galaxy note 10.1 s-pen. of course, the only thing that can improve is the quality of the writing (not as clear as papyrus)

I've been using lecture notes for a couple of weeks and find it to be the perfect note app for me.  It works flawlessly.  I'm generally a slow learner, but this is laid out so well it took just a few moments to be up and running.
Excellent app
Saving my butt in college I'll tell you that!!!
Basically the best note taking app out there. I use it for writing my lecture notes, then to read / edit them while giving the lecture. It's the only piece of software which is comparable to OneNote
This app does everything I want in a very user friendly way.  Ive tried 8 other note apps on android and ios. This one is my favorite.

I bought this as a replacement for S-Note on my Galaxy Note, as I just couldn't get on with it at all.  LectureNotes is miles better and much more user friendly. I much prefer to write than to type on a fiddly tablet keyboard, and this app lets me do that with the minimum of fuss. Great job!

DOES EVERYTHING a note-taker is suppossed to do, but one thing: editing the properties of objects (color & line-thickness). If that is done, perfection will be reached - and even without this feature, is the best note taking app out there (including S-note).
This is the best productivity app on my note 10.1. I recommend this to anyone on android OS.
A little complicated to set up but well worth the effort.  Exactly what ive been looking for.
Great app for note taking of all types, not just lecture notes
Please add an export to Google Drive or Google Keep option.
Nutze es für das Studium und es erleichtert einem das Leben um so einiges
The best note taking app on the market. Good for annotating pdfs also. Very customisable. S pen friendly. Widget notes are also handy!
the best note taking app for me thus far
A brilliant APP does exactly what I need.
This is the best app I have found for taking notes. I use it for creating lecture notes, taking notes at meetings, even creating keys for exams.
A very good app for note taking

I like how his app is geared towards students. Its easy to use, and is feel more natural then using some other note taking apps. Also, i can rest my palm on the screen with out havin the app go in to a fit

Love it. App developer helped me with some setup issues, which was great. Note 10.1 can be tricky when it comes to saving on external SD cards, but this app pulls it off. Would still like to see some sort of password implemented for security reasons. A lot of people would like to know that nosy friends, children, etc are unable to see or accidentally erase what they write. Am currently using another app to lock this one, but would appreciate not having to use extra apps to make up for what this app lacks.
Best note-taking app by far! I agree Samsung should pay royalties! :-)

This app is the reason I bought a tablet. Has everything you could want in a note taker & then some.  Highly customizable, yet incredibly useful & functional. Use it for all my notes in all my engineering classes. S-Note doesn't even come close to this. Samsung should have to pay royalties to this dev, because I would've returned my Note 10.1, if not for this app. There is a bit of learning curve involved because of all the various settings & options but there is a great "help" section that explains everything in detail and the results are well worth it.
This is the single most important application for my note 10.1. Now paper is just dull.
Sure is easy to use
Would just like closer integration with dropbox and evernote would be good
Convenient, consistent, and function rich

The amount of options that let me change things that were driving me nuts in SNote is amazing! Top class app. Keep up the good work. So much better than SNote. I'd love to see your take on maths formulas detection

I've tested loads of note taking apps on my Galaxy Note 8, and LectureNotes is far above the competition. My paper notebooks have been replaced by the unbeatable combination of a Galaxy Note 8 and LectureNotes.  Only a few minor details separate it from perfection : 1) It should be possible to disable the buttons at the bottom of the tablet. 2) The Evernote export function recreates a new notebook on each exportation, despite having configured the correct settings (use notebook uuid)
replyContent: 1. This can only be done on rooted devices. 2. Presently, there is no `EDIT_NOTE´ intent for Evernote, LN uses the `CREATE_NOTE´ intent with persistent notebook UUID. An `EDIT_NOTE´ intent has been announced (Google for `evernote "edit_note"´), this will be added to LN as soon as it has been added to the API.

content: Best note taking app on my Note 10.1 hands down!

I think every EverNote user that finds this app has a major sigh of relief!  Skitch is for doodling, LectureNotes is for professional and (obviously) edu application.  Very easy to name a notebook by account/subject/idea/etc and then add a time stamped notebook within, which then come up in chronological order + send direct to EN.  I am using the Samsung Galaxy Note 8.0, had to adjust a few settings since this app was developed for the full size tablet, but the app instantly recognized the smaller screen and told me where to go and what to adjust!  I am giving 5 stars, in hopes that LN can address the following: 1) on the Galaxy Note 8.0, the menu/home/back button at the bottom of the tablet in portrait get bumped when in stylus mode - Is there any way to auto disable those buttons while in Portrait Mode?  2) although skitch is an inferior app, you can pick the area on the page where you want to start typing text, is there a way to do this?  In keyboard mode, it only allows me to press enter to go down to the next line.... 3) Is there a template that could be setup to write notes on one side and type on the other side of the page?  Also could template be setup in Landscape?
replyContent: 1) No, the lower bar is under system control (only the back key can be disabled in the app's handling settings). 2) The text layer is essentially an embedded word processor; there is also a text drawing tool which allows free placement. 3) Interesting idea; you could set the margins for the text layer to achieve somewhat like that.

content: This app is incredible; just when I think it can't get any better, the developer improves it again.  Blows away the competition. I'm using it on a galaxy note 8.
This is leaps and bounds better than the S-note app that comes with the Galaxy Note 10.1 It makes taking notes in class functional.
good app but unable to sync note from my samsung note 10.1 to my samsung galaxy s3.not sure whether its possible or we just have to export to evernote
replyContent: LectureNotes usage of many individual files to store notebook pages is ideal for syncing your notes with a cloud service. To do so, set the app directory to a place on your SD card that gets automatically synced by the syncing app of your favorite cloud service. Doing that on several devices will keep the devices synced as well.

content: Love these so much! Haven't taken paper notes at all this session!  Could use waaay more of a tutorial however.
Exactly what I was looking for. Sync with multiple devices via dropsync and full landscape support.

Paired this note taking app with my tablet. There a 1,001 handwriting note taking apps (and I've already tried maybe half a dozen of them), but the flexibility and variety of input options on this one makes all the difference.

After trying numerous note taking applications, it quickly became apparent that lecture notes is far and above the absolute best application for SERIOUS note taking as a university student or business professional. If you're looking to replace traditional journals or notebooks, lecture notes has  been the only application so much more powerful than that of a traditional pen and paper that I feel so very limited trying to use pen and paper. Even with capacitive screens, lecture notes is by far the best!
Exactly what I was looking for
Brilliant

Liked it when I had an Asus Transformer, love it now I have a 10" Galaxy Note! Every feature I've wanted is there and importing pdfs is a wonderful alternative to annotating them via pdf viewers.  Very stable and taking the time to learn all the features is well worth it, I'm yet to find something I can't do without a bit of poking around the settings.   In addition to this the developer responds quickly and thoroughly to enquiries, seems like a top bloke :)

I have been using this every day in my classroom as a math and physics teacher.  It has been very useful to organize my notes, and with the pdf export feature I am able to save electronic copies of notes for students to access.
Good app.
Very versatile. Reliable. Suitable for elaborate mathematics.  Regular useful updates.  Puts S Note to shame.
Why the import of pdf files doesnt work anymore? the only option to import is from dropbox.
replyContent: To select a local file, you need to install a file manager app for file selection. At the moment, the DropBox app is the only app on your device that had registered with the Android system as `file selector´.

content: I've read and researched all of the current android note taking apps for my nexus 7 and 10. This is by far the best one out there. During school, I used OneNote which is a fantastic program but unfortunately their app is completely different than the original program and lacking in everything that I use daily for note taking. I was very disappointed when I found this out but luckily Lecture Notes came to my rescue. There are so many options in this program it is really worth the time to watch videos and read up on help to figure out its full potential. Right now, I organize my folders by rotation and in each rotation I have the topics sorted by notebooks. In each notebook I take notes with the keyboard (and also my wireless bluetooth keyboard), I write with my stylus, and I draw graphs/pictures. I also store each topic in my filing system (ES file explorer) by converting whole notebooks into pdf's. I print them (4 pages per paper) to study them with a hard copy. You can also export to other things like Google Drive or Evernote. You can create layers, cut/copy/paste etc.  I haven't even had enough time to use it to it's full potential but I definitely recommend this app!

SNote is great for jotting quick notes, but for more serious work, where a series of 'notebooks' makes more sense, LectureNotes is the best by far IMO. I tried a bunch of other handwriting apps on my Galaxy Note 2, but this one had the best combination of writing feel, options, and a developer who is responsive and always working hard.  If you have a need to take a lot of notes, take a good look at LectureNotes - you may be able to replace paper notebooks altogether.

I've finally found the right program for note taking at meetings, it seems infinitely configurable and stands head and shoulders above the other handwriting programs I've tried.  As if that wasn't enough, the program's author is particularly responsive and helpful. An all-around great deal.

The developer is awesome lecture Notes was great on my Asus Transformer. But I just got a Galaxy Note 2 and WOW! It is amazing. (I replaced my Transformer with a Note 10.1 mostly because of Lecture Notes). It actually does replace paper notebooks.  My only wish is for a complete integration with Evernote (tags and notebooks for organization;and two way syncing - so you could edit and update notes from multiple devices).

S Note is better than this I wont reccommend this!  I don not see the reason for this app now! If you have evernote and upload to evernote and still create note book! I would definitely recommend The Evernote! BEST THING TO ORGANISE NOTES! Galaxy note 10.1 and evernote good combo!   MOJO
Best note-taking app I've found

I made a suggestion to improve the input zone and the developer implemented it and sent me a follow up email letting me know he had updated it. Needless to say this is the best note taking app on Android.

I am satisfied on using this app, it is good event for a nexus 7 which does not utilised for hand writing. However, I try to use keyboard to type in it and cannot find a way to access the font size. The only way is to click the smaller and larger, which is seems really slow? any helpp? Overall, it is amazing app!
replyContent: You can set the font size independently for the text layer and the text drawing tool in the app's handling and tools settings, respectively.

content: I love all the features on this app & was really looking forward to using it, however I cant seem to find a stylus that produces descent handwriting on my galaxy tab 2 7".  Would happily give more stars if I was able to use properly.  Any suggestions would be appreciated.   Thanks x
replyContent: On devices with capacitive stylus such as the Galaxy Tab 2, I recommend to use the `input zone´, this will provide an area at the bottom of your display to write into; whatever you write there will get scaled down (to compensate for the lower resolution of capacitive stylus) and placed at the position indicated by the `cursor´.

content: 3 months on ..  Been using Lecture Notes now for almost 3 months. I almost never use a 'day book' at work any more. Its all written, exported to PDF and saved in the cloud.     Even better is to take a document to review, import it into lecture notes, create a layer and scribble comments. Additional iterations is a breeze as more layers can be added.    The developer is really helpful and gets back on any comments or suggestions (wish lists) very quickly and although S-Notes has some great features, I almost never use it.    As before -great app and well underpriced        06Mar13  A colleague bought the samsung galaxy note 10.1 and downloaded this app. I was so impressed I retired my two tablets and bought one. This app means I am practically paper free. I dont use a day book any more and can print off any notes made or save them as pdf...  The updates are frequent and when I  emailed the writter to query whether a particular feature would be issued.. reply in 20 mins with a detailed response (along with other emails to follow on).  Seems underpriced for what it does and what it is capable of

I bought LN as a replacement for S-Note on my Galaxy Note 10.1 since the latest SN update has zooming issues. LN works great with my Bamboo stylist and the author responded quickly to a few initial questions I had. I see no need to go back to SN. Looking forward to future developments. Great work!
Great alternative to SNote

Everything you could possibly need. Something that would be great is the option to automatically back everything up to Google drive or evernote. This way you could use it across all of your devices. Update: I'm not a developer so I dont know how it works, but since Google just released a cloud app sync maybe you could impliment that.
perfect app.  I love doodling during meetings but being able to type, mark up on pdfs. evernote is  portable but too restrictive.  lucky lecture notes export works so well with evernote.

This really is an amazing app, just as the reviews say.  I tried Samsung's S-Note, and this one's just so much more flexible and powerful.  It does take a little digging around, but in 10 minutes you'll discover what to do with most of the settings.  You can import virtually any file, export and share, set backgrounds, grids and lines, and fully configure the pens and pen behaviors.  Just fantastic.  This was my one "analog" thing left in life - taking notes in meetings and at church/in bible studies.  And your program lets me convert!  FYI, I'm sharing to both Dropbox and Evernote, and both work great.
Does everything I want it to.
Gracious
Best note taking app by far. And great response time from Devs.
Best note taking app so far
Quite simply. Does everything I want and way, way more.
One suggestion. This is a very professional application but the icon is very Jr. High... compared to the application the icon is awful.
Best note taking app, hands down

Very user friendly.  I use a Friendly Swede stylus and it works great.  The fine pen setting works best.  I like the custom settings.  Each folder is a different color, each notebook is a different color as well as the lines in the notebooks.  I've used for two semesters.  My bag is a lot lighter not having it full of notebooks for each course.  I recommend getting Lecture Recordings.  Depending on the device, it picks up everything remaining clear.

This is a very useful all app,  it is very customizable for users needs.  The Google team should put these app developers to better use.  All LectureNotes apps are very useful.   The app has many features,  makes note taking simple and effective.   This app is one of the main reasons I bought my tablet.  Worth every penny.
fantastic App, does everything and  more, also very customizable
For my needs,  this is the best note taking app. There are many features and customizations, bit the basic functionality is also superb.

I've tried (pretty much) every note taking app that one could find for a variety of platforms (Tablet PC, iPad, and not Galaxy Note 10.1). Combined with the active stylus, this is exactly what one would expect out of a digital notebook -- the greatness of paper note taking with the ease of digital!  The interface and usage take a little time to get used to, but it's well worth the effort. It's raster based, so it's fast, but don't expect it to be a vector notebook. The developer is very responsive and helpful, and it's obvious that much care and thought has gone into this application. It's very customizable without being unnecessary or convoluted. In a true act of kindness, the underlying notebook data is stored as png files, and the location of everything can be specified by the user. It's easy to backup/import/export, and everything can be edited on a computer.  If you like handwritten notes with the benefits of digital (moving, copying, pasting, etc.), then this is your app! Seriously. Try the others if you want, but you'll see the difference :)

Combo this with lecture notes recordings, and say goodbye to pen and paper note taking for ever.  Developer support is amazing too, received a response very promptly.   Can't recommend this app enough. Well done Acadoid.
My only complaint is  would like to be able to highlight part of the notes, otherwise it's great.
replyContent: Tastes concerning highlighters differ widely, you can make one of the custom pencils to act as a highlighter, choose your favorite color and width, an intermediate alpha, and enable `draws behind other colors´. To quickly change to the highlighter, show the pencil toolbox, a single click sets the pencil.

content: Keep the good work, also bought the recording app.

I've been using this software for more than a year on galaxy note 1 and galaxy note 10.1, it is simply great and matchless. I've used this effectively in meetings, classroom lectures and it has never disappointed me. Much better than SNore. Great work Markus.....
Simply a must have app for handwriting on tablets. Very responsive and helpful developer with regards to queries about the app, worth every bit of the price tag!
Worth to buy, very useful app.
I have spent months trialling different solutions for note taking on different devices and this is the best, with Quill a close second but lacking the import and layer facilities.
Great application.  Friendly developer. Lots of features. Far superior to S Note for note taking.
This app is incredible. Hands down the best app I've ever used. In combination with the recording component, I have no excuse not to take notes. Can't wait to see what you do next!
replyContent: You can set a custom PDF directory in the app's storage settings, so that all exported PDF files go there, and let this directory automatically sync with your favorite cloud service. If you prefer manual upload, enable `share exported PDF´ in the app's export settings and choose your cloud service as destination.

content: I have been looking for something that could compete with note taker HD for the iPad and this is it. It has zoom functions that easily allow you to write within the lines and has the ability to type notes as well. I have to say this is hands down the best app for hand written notes for android tablets. You need to adjust the settings to your liking but that's to be expected.

It is an excellent digital replacement for the paper notebook. Very intuitive interface with a tank load of options! Thank you!  I was looking for an app that could help me write, draw and organize all the work that I do in one place, preferably in my own handwriting. I am delighted to share that this one app does it all and does it well! Thank you so much!  The icons could be made sexier though.
Wonderful note talking app, cut and paste feature is really awesome!

Having tried a number of these products, lecturenotes has finally given me something that works. Although you do have to be prepared to spend enough time on it to get it set up for your writing style, by configuring it properly . I also found it works well with the Bamboo Stylus with its slightly smaller tip. I would highly recommend this product if you are seeking to reduce or even eliminate your dependency on paper notebooks.....

Bought Galaxy Note 10.1, was very disappointed with some peculiar choices Samsung made in the first update to its S-Note application, amongst other things. I was about to return it when I stumbled onto Lecture Notes, this app was EXACTLY what I was looking for! Does so much that I wanted, has a high level of customizability- it really is almost the one-note clone I was looking for on a lighter weight, longer-lived tablet. All my gripes are satisfied, reading the help file solved all my problems, should've d

Using nexus  7. Works very well my only qualm is with palm rejection which might be due to my tablet. In any case it makes writing more frustrating because none of the palm rejection settings work for me, either that or I don't know how to set it up properly
replyContent: On devices with capacitive stylus, I recommend to use the `input zone´ as input method. This input method provides an area at the bottom of the display, whatever you write there will get scaled down (to compensate for the lower resolution of capacitive stylus) and placed at the position indicated by the `cursor´.

content: Such a good app for the galaxy note 10.1. Exactly what I need for academic work.

I note everything in my classes with this. It is very convinient to write down, but adding pdf files is still inconvinient and heavy. I realky like it since I don't need to carry heavy papers nor to scan my notes anymore.

One thing, this should be syncable with Google docs so all of your notes are accessible through Google docs.  Make sure it automatically uploades notes after they are written.  Other than that I think I can honestly say this is the best app I have ever downloaded. I used s note before this on my galaxy note 10.1 and there is no comparison. I was about ready to go back tonpaper and pencil and then I found this app. Couldn't be happier!
The only problem I'm having is that since I enabled the "Hide system bar" option, every time I happens it changes my wallpaper to a solid black color.
replyContent: This is a known side-effect (note that Live Wallpapers are not affected).

content: Great app! Just wanted to suggest if you could implement handwriting input like the app Freenote. But nonetheless, its good. :)
Wonderful App

I've only used this briefly so far but it seems good over all.  One very important and quite odd thing has stopped me using it more. It looks like text entered does not end up in exported PDFs as text - ie it is converted to image.  Fixing this would make me WAY MORE confident about using this app long term! Developer can you fix this please.

Struggling to find a function/feature I want that is not there! Loads of options enable you to make the Note work the way you want.Use it every day and has replaced pen and paper..And, awesome response time for questions and help from developer. Great stuff.
Developer really responsive and this app is a real gem! Buy it!
replyContent: Many thanks, glad to hear that.

content: One little niggle... I have the option to hide the status bar set when in a notebook,  and this seems to turn my wallpaper black (very minor issue,  is fixed by a device reboot).  Honestly Samsung should pay you for this,  miles ahead of S Note.  Keep it up! Note 10.1

I don't write reviews on apps unless they are amazing (...or awful) and this app is outstanding!!!  The customization and advanced features on it are exactly what I was looking for.  I tried other apps before finding this one and LectureNotes blows them out of the water.  The value of this app is so much more than what I paid.  I gladly pay for apps from developers that are this good and devoted.  Thank you Acadoid!
The customer support was excellent but this app doesnt work very well with maxtouuch devices.
replyContent: I am sorry that the app doesn't work well on this device and that we couldn't resolve it.

content: I was wondering why i bought my galaxy for school.....then i found this app. It has really helped in taking notes in school (pharmacy.)

Fantastic, just what I have been looking for.  Very feature rich and extremely flexible in set up.  Allows you to set defualt folder location which is great as I was looking for an app the alowed me to save files directly into my boxcryptor folder in dropbox. Works well with s pen on Note 10.1 (optimised for it it seems).  Only feature I'd like to see added is the ability to "save as" - at the moment it seems as if you have to go into the notebook settings and change the name there, which works but it a bit of a fiddle.   Overall a great app and having found this app I cant see what all the fuss is about re: penultimate - this app is light years ahead ( and available for android right now). Uploads to evernote seemlessly as well..
Awesome awesome app

Overall, I really like this app and it is a great tool that is very customizable.  The export to Evernote feature is great, and the general note taking interface is also very clean and easy to use.  The only frustrating thing about this app is when it updates on my samsung galaxy note tablet, it just closes the app and updates it - without first saving the note I am currently working in.  It drives me nuts when this happens and I re-open the note only to find that the last 5 minutes of notes have been lost and I have to redo them.  It would seem like a simple thing to first save the note before updating the application.  Other than that, I would highly recommend this app to anyone taking notes on a galaxy (or other) tablet.
replyContent: I am sorry to hear about the problem, but it is not caused by LectureNotes. The Google Play app does not properly shutdown apps  (which would allow LectureNotes to save your notes) before updating them, it just kills them. I strongly recommend to disable `auto-update´ and update manually upon notification.

content: Use it all the time in meetings to make notes, has become an important part of my briefcase..quick and simple to use. Wish I had discovered it months ago.

Its the only note taking app on android that lets you import PDFs! Would it be possible to have an option to turn on a zoomed in box that would allow for easier annotation? That's the only upgrade I could think of. Keep up the good work!!
replyContent: You can either zoom the whole page, or use the input method `input zone´ (which is recommended for a device with a capacitive stylus).

content: This app is great and has constant updates. As a engineering student who takes a lot of handwritten notes during lectures, the extra tails added whenever you lift your stylus can be irritating especially when you're trying to keep up with class. Would be great if this is fixed but until then im withholding a star. P.s. ive tried tweaking filter settings, etc without improvements.
replyContent: Enabling the pressure filter with a threshold of about 5% (and disabling the other filters) should resolve the problem.

content: If you bought a pen tablet for writing and organizing your notes, then this is for you. At this price it's a steal! Buy it, and I doubt you'll regret it!
This app is awesome! I appreciate the written explanations of the options. This app is developed very well.  Big thumbs up.

First off, let me say that I've been on an iPad 2 for the past 9 months - I gave it an honest go... but I'm so glad to be back on Android (Galaxy Tab 2 10.1)!!!  This app is a very close comparison to the GoodNotes app on iPad, with two small downfalls.  1. The GoodNotes app was very useful in that you could place a magnifying box on the PDF you're writing on, and it would make a max-zoomed field at the bottom of the screen to write in.  The writing in the zoomed-field was spectacular - and achieved without having to zoom in on the page.  If this feature exists, I apologize, I just haven't found it yet. 2. It needs a highlighter!!!  Just yellow would be fine, but those two features would make this app PERFECT!!!
replyContent: 1. The input method that you describe is called `input zone´ in LectureNotes. 2. Tastes concerning highlighters differ widely, you can make one of the custom pencils to act as a highlighter, choose your favorite color and width, an intermediate alpha, and enable `draws behind other colors´.

content: And Markus goes well beyond the call of duty in helping his customers. Really excellent, both the app and the developer! This has now become my most favourite app on both my phone and my tablet. (Galaxy S3 and Galaxy Note 10.1)

This app is great, make a nicer interface, im sure more people will buy it	I hope you will include highlighter, some math function recognition like the s note, and make it faster to overview the  the pages or some other methods to scroll through the pdf book quickly with a little preview so that i know which page to stop
I have an HTC flyer and this app is 100 times better than any app available for Android. Can you make it available for Windows 8 tablets?

I use this application on my Galaxy Note 10.1 because of the connectivity advantages over S-Note. The app is more than worth the $4 price tag and will keep your hand-written notes and annotated .pdfs in order. It has allowed me to forget about taking notes on paper completely!  One feature I would like to see is the option to sort notes by date created within a folder. Also, I currently sync my notes with Evernote, but I would like to see a feature that could allow sync with Google Keep.  Keep up the good work!
Good app. It will be better if it has color hi light option
replyContent: Tastes concerning highlighters differ widely, you can make one of the custom pencils to act as a highlighter, choose your favorite color and width, an intermediate alpha, and enable `does not draw in font but behind other colors´.

content: Laggy on nexus ten but I love the input zone feature! Please optimize :)

I spend more time with this app than any other on my Galaxy Note 10.1 tablet. It has a learning curve - you will want to read the help, but you'll be glad you learned it. It has replaced my note-taking on actual paper. It's just as easy as scribbling on paper, but my thoughts stay more organized when sorted into folders and notebooks, and dropping a quick snapshot of a website or email into my notes to mark up and highlight is something I couldn't really manage with a steno pad.
This is hands down the best note taking app in the market .....I have not used pen and paper after I purchased this application. Two thumbs up!!!!

I bought other apps for handwriting using my note 2 and this is the best so far. However the one thing that requires developer attention which is not rooting the phone to hide the sys banner because many apps do it without rooting! Why can't the developer do the same? at least for phones that support it without rooting. Serious users don't root to guarantee stability and secure the contents of the phone.

Awesome app.  I tried the free version for several days and found this app very flexible, easy to use (although there are a lot OF OPTIONS. maybe to many...)  It was perfect for all of my note needs.  Emailed the developer and he was very quick to respond.  the only reason I did not give this a 5 star rating is that I would like to see some option for password locking of notebooks.  But other than that...  for me this is a complete hand writing app for the Droid system.  Nicely done developer. :-)
love this one, have installed the trial version before i buy... satisfied ! thanks fOr the deveeloper for a quick reply for my questions! always support! dankee

Hello, I would like to have my notes synchronized between my tablet and my phone, so that when I don't one I can still use the other and write and check the same notes in either of them. How to do this?
replyContent: This can be achieved by automatically synchronizing your devices with your favorite cloud service (either the device's whole SD card or the LectureNotes' app directory specifically), thereby automatically synchronizing devices as well.

content: First day with this app. I normally use OneNote for my student's music notebooks, but I had to send the computer to be repaired.  Takes a few minutes to find all the bells and whistles , but they're there!  I usually send each notebook as a .pdf attachment, is there an easy way to do that without having to drill down to find the .pdf export?
replyContent: Exported PDF are stored in the notebook directory as default. You can set a PDF directory in the app's storage settings, then exported PDF files will go there (alternatively, set the app directory to a custom and easier accessible place).

content: Great App, but text editing could be better

I just recently started using this app to take notes and assist my studies. It is excellent compared to all the other choices but I have a few things that I feel should be there.   I like to take screenshots and use keyboard to add notes, but clicking on keyboard activates the entire region on the page and you have to space/tab to past the pasted image to begin typing. A customizable region would be ideal so you can select a block where you would like to type.  Also with image imports, it would be amazing if you could open them in an edit mode so they can be cropped before pasting  into your page.  That's all I can think of for now. If these are made I will change to 5 stars. Keep up the good work dev
Incredible response on XDA forum.
It's really the kind of functionality I wanted when I bought my tablet. Very good indeed.

Works great on the nexus 10 for taking notes in class. The developer is also really good about responding to suggestions (personally I used a forum on xda and got a response within a few hours) and implementing fixes for bugs. Truly a well made and well supported android application.

This app is great to use and is making my quest to go paper less easier.  I would love if highlighters could be incorporated into this app then it would really be like writing on paper but without killing the trees.
Thank you for using an open file format!

Looking for a good note taking  app. for college and found lecture notes,  all the reviews were top notch so I decided to give it a try. With my galaxy 10.1 this app. is truly amazing, want to make my own stars and add it to the 5.

The developer is constantly updating to add even more features to this already robust app. One suggestion: A "zoom input" for stylus handwriting input, like Antipaper. I would like to be able to write small, but still see the whole page.
replyContent: This input method is called `input zone´ in LectureNotes.

content: Love this app! For anyone trying to find an app to take notes, doodle around, or just brainstorm and make diagrams. Really great. Small details could be improved over time, but great app. Definitely worth the money.

I love it but I wish there was an easy way to print, a way to rotate pdfs inserted, and most importantly an eraser such as in apps like notability that erase whole characters rather than a free flow circle.
This has replaced all my notebooks. - Galaxy Note 2
Friend showed me this app and in love with it! Saves paper, ink and loads of unneccesary mess at uni :)
Best I've found by far, much better than S note on my galaxy note 10.1
I use this to take notes in my university classes. Its great! I wish the upload to drop box feature would upload a PDF, not just the PNG images, but there's a workaround for that.
I think its a great app, does what offers, but I would absolutely love if I had more pencil and color options. Im a visual learner so I tend to color code certain fragments of my notes.

Don't let its name fool you into believing its just for lecture notes.  This encapsulated environment is just outstanding. For using this app for over a month now, it has become my infinite mind dump from which countless lost moleskines were once used before. Amplified of course by the fact that I am using this on a nexus 7.   There even support for active stylii but unfortunately I do not have experience with these features but I can assume they work just as well as every other feature in this app.

Usually I don't write reviews because rarely I appreciate the quality of an app. I have to say that this app is amazing. Works flawlessly and it the most productive app there is. The ability to record while writing (needs the lecturerecording app) works great With this my galaxy note 10.1 works with its full potential.  A must have combination (note 10.1 and this app) for any science student (i.e. one that needs to draw formulas )

I downloaded the demo and after using it for only a day realised that I couldn't afford not to have the full version product. Compared to the other note book apps out there, this one stands out way ahead of all of the rest. Very easy and intuitive interface, good features for organising multiple documents, great support for PDF including page import if you install the free plugin, but for me there are two features that totally won me over. The first being the speed at which the app responds to the stylus, and the second being the heuristics that recognise the difference between legitimate input and a resting wrist.  This app on my Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 has me believing once again in the possibility of the utopian paperless office, and perfectly replaces the stock S-Note app which didn't meet my high expectations, whereas Lecture Notes has easily exceeded them.
Wow, that developer made everything I've requested!
It is unbelievable how good this app is, with constant updates and everything working flawless and smooth, tons of options and very good handwriting recognition.

This is hands down the best note taking app possible for the Galaxy Note devices. No other app even compares to the speed and versatility of Lecturenotes. I use this for engineering notes and it has allowed me to go completely paperless. I would love to see a dotted line option in the custom toolbox and maybe someone could figure out how to stop the little extra strokes and misscalibration you get using the Bamboo Wacom Feel stylus. Keep up the awesome work with this app!
This app is starting to rival even note taker HD on iOS, the developer is also fantastic. Would like to see font changing for keyboard entering though
Better than any app on the apple app store. Best app I've used. Just get it (there's a trial too)
In regards to an earlier, it was a screen orientation problem. It can import pdfs entirely.
replyContent: Glad to hear that the problem is solved, thanks your revising the review accordingly.

content: This app is so amazing.. works well especially with pdf documents. My note 10.1 is perfect for this app. Only thing to mention, it has way too many updates! Leave it alone, it works!  Updat: latest update caused a crash and I lost some notes.... please fix, and leave it alone!
replyContent: Sorry to hear about the problem. I recommend to disable `automatic update´, then the Google Play app will only notify you about the availability of an update and it is your decision whether you download it or not.

content: Thanks developers... Impressive work
... and I have tried quite a few.  keep it up.

As a senior in high school, this app on my note 10.1 has made taking notes and doing hw in my ap classes neet, organized-something my old spiral notebook never was-and easier than ever! User support is also good since the developer is great about providing updates. I highly recommend this app to anyone and everyone in need of a notebook-like app!
I use this all the time one of my favorites
Great app! Developer is very prompt with replies and very helpful! Updates are consistent as well! Best note taking app by far!!

I really like this app for writing.  It's simple and efficient, but with plenty of options to allow you to adjust settings to meet your needs.  Author responds quickly to emails, every friendly and nice.  I prefer this app over the s note app that came with my tablet.  Probably the best note taking software on the market.

After initial setup, this has been one of the most beneficial apps I've installed.  To use it in tandem with Evernote, GoogleDrive, and QuickOffice is a breeze. These combined with AnyConnect give me everything I need to work efficiently without hauling a laptop around.  Like anything, you're only going my to get the full potential of the app if you dedicate the time to learn it.
The only pen app I use for work and teaching.

Sync the android/lecturenotes/files folder and you can auto sync your notes with your phone and view them on PC.  I hope this doesn't change because your simple file formats are what make this product perfect for me. Worth every cent.

Great app and full of customization but no matter what I do, I write neat using this app.  I've used a silicon tip stylus and a microfiber tip one.  Also, the settings for stylus' make it so that the app won't detect strokes using one.  Please improve these things.  I've used other apps like ghostwriter for iOS and my handwriting is great.
Great app. Great support.

Shortly after installing this my tablet began to slow down. I wondered why and the tech at Best Buy said that it was this app. It was nice while it lasted. Loved the personalization of pens and backgrounds and such. Ok app if it hadn't messed up my tablet.
replyContent: Sorry to hear about the problems with your tablet. However, the APK available in Google Play does certainly not contain any virus.

content: This is the app I've been waiting for. Totally customisable, fast, and easy to use. This will do away with my meeting notebooks. Makes the Galaxy Note 10.1 a truly useful and productive tool.

IDEA: Add the ability to add "pop-up"/sticky notes. It should be easy to implement, since you already have layers. But the ability to see a small icon, easily open a note/layer clicking on it and  that it closes automatically when you click outside would be really useful. IDEA2: HD widgets
Highly customisable ui and very intuitive features. This is possibly the best Android app I have seen so far for Note 10.1

Would like to see a plain and simple alphabetical index. The grouped by notebook title is ok for large notebooks but how does one search for a  notebook by key word. Ability to search archives would be good too.

I got the Note 10.1 because, though I love new gadgets, I am still kinesthetic and have not been able to let go of the feel of writing with pen and paper. I have tested about all of the pen with note apps around,  and LectureNotes, though not perfect,  is the best I've found.     Pros Highly customizable pens,  paper,  and layout NOTEBOOK INDEXING!!! Book covers Book widgets Lots of cool tools to do more than I expected (like working in layers,  great for creating visual media)  Cons Many functions are not intuitive (like changing page size!) No variety for book covers Widget only is for page view, you can work around this... No simple bookmarking.  Overall, I like this app and use it daily at work.  I still use sNote for personal journal stuff,  but nothing else has given me this type of flexibility on the go!
When i saw noteability for ipad, i looked for an android equivalent. There are still features missing, and the handwriting recognition/resolution still leaves a lot to be desired.
Been wanting something likes this for awhile... just never considered this app existed; duh I know. This app works perfectly.

This app was mentioned in many reviews for the Galaxy Note 10.1 and I'm so glad it was! This is an excellent app for both note taking, and when used with PDFView, for making notes on imported PDFs. It works like a charm for knitting patterns and class material alike, as while as for taking notes during class. The developer is very helpful and responds quickly to questions. Extremely useful and well designed app!
all of the features in this app are very useful for taking lecture notes, and customer service also give fast and good response, really love it !
I am able to design yoga classes with this app. The only thing is I can't copy and paste between notebooks which would save me time drawing.
When a problem came up, the response was less than 24 hours to fix it, I wish the other apps took as much care. THANK YOU!
which means it is somewhat ok, but cannot be compared to what is standard for iOS for similar apps. at least add movable text boxes.
Best note taking app. Notebooks board could be bit more polished/sleek. Otherwise simply great.

It took about 20 minutes to get my head around how the interface works and to get everything setup in a way that makes sense for me, but since then, taking notes has been awesome.  I use the Galaxy Note 10.1 with stylus and I find myself wanting to write everything in this app rather than on paper.  Only complaint is that I can't use the cutter tool and move things between pages.
This app is perfect for university. It is elegantly simple yet it has everything I want in a notebook: drawing, typing, good organisation, pdf export, import pdf and images, records audio, etc

This app recognizes the hardware stylus on Galaxy Note devices, allowing for great palm rejection, and pressure response.  I would also argue that this is the best note taking app on any platform. It handles layers more elegently than OneNote, and has never crashed or lost notes for me (I've been backing up to Evernote just in case).
An intuitive and useful app. Love the customization options, as well as the ability to export my notes to pdf. Dropbox integration works marvelously. Great work!

This is perfect for me - i love every bit of it. Handwritten notes are there, the line steps will go per line if you so choose (which is perfect) it's nice to be able to connect my transformer dock and type some notes as well (which do stay...)  Thank you very much for this app!
I would pay $20 for this.  Does everything.  Almost...
Great app!

Very pleased with it. At last I can fully replace a paper notepad with an electronic one. Love the ability to edit in several layers - you can separate the original text from comments added later. Very easy to use and switch between the tools. Some suggestions - it would be nice to have an option to close the book without saving or at least to save a whole book with a new name. Also it would be good if design of the covers for folders differ from the one of notebooks themselves. At the moment the differnce is just a "rubber band" in the coner, but real folder look would be good.
Perfect. Smooth and professional application.  Am using it for my Master study

This is without a doubt the most responsive developer I have ever encountered. Lecturenotes the most useful app I have on my Galaxy Note 10.1. Compared with any other similar app (S Note, Quill, Papyrus) this one is the most customizable and most intuitive of them all. And it seems that it simply gets better and better literally every week. It is well worth the price. Support this developer and buy this app if you need a pen and paper replacement for a tablet with an active digitizer.

Ive stopped using pen and paper and started using this app on my Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 in all my classes at the university in Trondheim, Norway (NTNU). I love the tablet and this app works great with it.

This wonderful app makes the mediocre Galaxy Note 10.1 into a life changing device. Because of this app I never need my printer to print out PDFs or docs. Never need pen and paper. In staff meetings I'll see people with an iPad and pen and paper next to it... pitiful.  This one app justified the existence and purchase of a stylus tablet like the Galaxy Note 10.1.

For taking notes, this app is second to none.  I just wish it could hand text (typing) a bit better - more in the style of ezpdf.  I like/need to do a combination of the two and am left wanting from each of the two programs.
This app is absolutely amazing on the galaxy note 10.1.
If you have a tablet and a stylus get this app now! The best app available for note taking complete with full PDF importing. Love this app
Cannot Get it to Work

Completely and utterly murders snote and other note apps.   Maybe not in as style but definitely user experience and total ease of use. Works like a dream for the note 10.1, in fact this is like a killer app for this tablet.
The developer and app are awesome.  I am in pharmacy school and I wish I had gotten a tablet and this app sooner.  A must have for the modern-day student
This app is perfect for students. The attitude of the developer is great. Thank you acadoid

As far as technical note taking apps go, this one is my favorite. I have tried a few on the market, and Lecture Notes is the most responsive when it comes to writing with stylus. Almost zero lag, and fidelity to the stylus movement is exceptional. A nice feature is the ability to use any page of any notebook as a widget - perfect for quick scribbles. Highly recommend this for engineers and professionals of all sorts.
I use it in my MBA studies, this app is far ahead from the nearest competitor.

It's been great to takes notes in it and all but the options for when typing are annoying there is no way to choose the size of the font without actually you having to do it manually and when you save it and then reopen it the font goes back to default. Other then it's pretty good. Hopefully they fix that

This app is truly a way to replace your paper clutter of meeting notes.  It is customizable and simple to use.   I use it for taking notes for business and personal use and don't know how I got along without it before.  The only thing that is missing is a dropbox snyc for backup.  Thanks for the great app

This app is just perfect, I've been using it in my Galaxy note 10.1 and I couldn't ask for more. It is intuitive and feature rich. It also has the active stylus feature that basically marries this app with my tablet. Also the developers constantly add enhancements to it so it's never outdated. If I would critique something is the lack of backup sync with Dropbox or Drive. In short it's worth the money, the best investment yet for the University or any note taking task.
fantastic app

This app is a truly indispensible tool for real note taking; especially if you use a stylus. Unlike many of the other note-taking apps I have tried, LectureNotes allows you to adjust and personalize the note-taking interface so that it works exactly the way you want it to work. For example, you can adjust whether you prefer to scroll with one or two fingers, whether you want to use your finger and/or a stylus as the pen input, customize what you want the secondary buttons on your stylus to do, etc.  If you take a lot of notes, I highly recommend this app.
Best Notebook app for android
Awesome support too, clear cut functions and very customisable. Love the new update, everything is faster now
What I feel would be nice is a built-in dictionary that check you spelling as you type and write. So far ican Say I am happy with this app.

l use this app everyday to take and organize my notes for ALL of my med school classes. It is by far one of the most useful apps for any Galaxy Note users. You can cut & paste with ease, which was a huge problem with S Note. This app met all of my note-taking needs in almost every category I can think of. Great job guys, thanks a ton!!
However if you flash a new ROM all your notes are gone! Need a sync service DEV!

I tried a dozen handwriting apps and this one is on top of my list. The handwriting quality is very good and readable and the app is complemented by an incredible set of features that really help you customize the page and writing experience. Hands down, the best handwriting app.
Best note app for sam note 10.1

Best handwriting, note taking app on the market. If you have a galaxy note 10.1 there is no better app. When you take the time to figure out the settings, and get it set up just the way you like, it will become your most used app. The options to only recognize stylus input and disable zooming, means I can use this just like a legal pad. No weird lines and I don't accidentally zoom or move the page with my palm. Which happened often in smemo even in stylus only mode.

Lecture Notes is hands down the best stylus driven note taking program for any android device. I wish it was a little more informative as to its features, I would have saved 5$'s on ezPDF reader's shoddy product. Once you get the hang of it this is the best annotation, note taking, and even lecture recording software around.

Replaced snote with this app. I love being able to have my digital books and this app opened side by side on my note 10.1 or this app next to my slide show presentation at lecture. No more binders and notebooks and it does EVERYTHING!! A must have for note owners! Note 10.1 with this app is amazing! You won't regret it!
I love to use this app at meetings, executing engineering studies, reviews... many things at work.  Easy to organize and share.

After looking around at all of the ways to keep track of and edit the pdf notes my professors upload, I found this app was the best.  The only improvement I would suggest is the ability to search text contained in the pdf documents once they're imported.

Solid app. Awesome developer. No unnecessary permissions required. Greatly simplified my life.  I use this to take notes, jot ideas and drawings, and write lectures. File format is png images, so you can easily get the data into other programs.

I absolutely love this note taking software! While it took a little bit of time to figure out all of the features, it seems to have an answer for everything! Notes are easy to take, organize, review and edit. The interface is smooth and extreemly customizable. I love it and would recomend it to anyone looking for an app that truly takes the best of the "paper and pencil" world and incorporates it with electronic conveniences!
I use this for work to eliminate all the notepads of paper for meetings. Works wonderful with Galaxy Note tablet.

This App is so close to what I want, the one thing that would really make this app great is if i can Select the size I wanted to use for font. Continually hitting smaller/larger is way too annoying for me, if you add that I will upgrade the stars and use the app more!

User interface is great. Customisability is great. One problem though if you're using the handwriting mode on a small tablet is you run out of space quickly, and moving the page is needlessly difficult. Hence I prefer an app like Handrite or Freenote, which shrink down your words to fit on the screen. But this is still good for typed notes.
Great for taking notes even when not using and active pen. However wondering if there is anyway to import a whole ppt that has been converted to PDF without having to go slide by slide. Thanks!
For Galaxy Note 10.1 owners: This is the note taking application you want to have. Trust me!

Fantastic app, continually improved by the developer. PDF imports now work much better - quickly multiple pages. The two things I'd like to see are:  1) Ability to insert a page at any point. At the moment it just add to the end. I import multiple PDF pages, then make notes. Sometimes I run out of space on the imported page, so it would be nice to be able to insert a blank page to continue notes. 2) Allow typed text to start anywhere on screen. Currently on selecting keyboard, the text is placed at top left of page. Maybe these functions exist and I just couldn't find them. UPDATE: You can "insert" a page by adding one to the end then going to the notebook overview and dragging it to the place you want it. I've also just found it's possible using the hand icon to add a page before or after the current page.
This is an excellent note taking app and is constantly being updated making it even better.

I have had tablet ever since the first ipad, I have spent lots and lots of money on trying to find a note app that I can conclusively use in meetings and elsewhere that can replace my paper notes. This is the first app in conjunction with the Samsung S Pen that does it well enough for me. I can sit in real life situations and write on my Galaxy Note 10.1 as if I am handwriting on a piece of paper. Brilliant app
This is my go to app for note taking.

I use this in all of my meetings. Awesome feature set, excellent response of developer to questions and regular improvements without breaking existing functionality.   Notebook backup and export to Dropbox is the icing on the cake. Best note taking app I found for Android and I have tried a lot!  Also supports dual screen mode on Galaxy Note 10.1.

This app is better than the other "note" apps if you're looking to replace your paper notebooks. Writing with a stylus is better than others. Takes a bit of set up because its sooo customizable. This is better than supernote in every way. And most like real paper. Very impressive!!
Developer is constantly upgrading/improving the app. Great support and a great, useful app.

Wanted a tablet to go full digital notes and loose the paper.  Looked hard at iPad2 and iPad4, Notes Plus, Notability, Penultimate, etc.  Reviews of this app were so good I went with my gut and stuck with Android as my phone is the same flavor and its been good to me.  No regrets at all -  very satisfied - works GREAT but please integrate Drop Box and OCR to typed text in future release!  That would make it a 6+ and on par with the Apple products.  Now I have an Asus Transformer Infinity with Kensington Pro2 Keyfolio keyboard, Logitech BT mouse, and stylus....fricken mobile 10" office using phone as wifi hot spot for internet.  Couldn't be happier.  This thing will leave an iPad4 at the light standing still and I've still got $200 in my pocket with room for memory expansion.  Lovin it.  Edit:  Funny how some people view frequent updates as a scary or bad thing.  Hey folks, it means that the dev is listening to our suggestions and implementing them quickly and frequently.  My hat's off to this dev.  Its the apps that don't get updates that scare me.

This app is amazing! I literally take nothing but my Nexus 7 to any of my classes anymore and am continually impressed with the many features. The developer is also top notch, I sent an email asking about syncing and backing up notebooks and received a very detailed answer early the next morning (original question was sent around midnight).

I use this app everyday in school and I sometimes forget that I am taking notes in my tablet and not on a piece of paper. If you are thinking about other apps look no further. I have tried all of the hand writing apps out there and this is by far my favorite. This app is so personalized and organized. No more need for a binder for each class, now all I need is my Boxwave stylus and this app on my nexus 7.
Works great with a stylus especially

I really like this application. I use it on my Samsung galaxy note 10.1 for college. I like how you can personalize the settings to suit preferences. The company is also constantly updating things which is great for better experiences. The only advice I would give is to select 'no' for automatic updating, as the program exits out suddenly. That's not a developer issue though, just something that all programs do.  It is smooth for handwriting and you can create custom pens. I created my own highlighters and colours to suit my needs. Exporting and back up is great as it gives you a lot of different options. When I back up, I back up to Google drive, but when someone in class wants my notes, I can share them straight into gmail.
Love the way the dev interacts with the users. best piece of soft I have on my tablet.

This is by far the most amazing app for notetaking & actually doing coursework	This is one of the few apps that is for more than just jotting down a few thoughts here & there. It is a complete replacement for lugging around a semesters worth of notebooks & PDF printouts. I haven't had a single issue with it so far & I don't expect to have one with how often it is updated. Hands down the most functional & practical app I've worked with. l'm iimpressed to say the least.
This is the best app I've ever used for notes.

Hands down. This program is updated with new features all the time. Many of those features are suggestions from users. If there's a feature lacking, be sure that it will be implemented soon. The Dev responds very quickly to emails. You can back up to Dropbox, Google drive, etc. by using the sharing icon from the first level of folders. I would like to request the ability to highlight. Be sure to read the help file. It helps a lot.

Nice updates by developer :-)   I agree with others: needs a simplistic way to add pages. Perhaps an auto insert page feature you can turn off/on whenever a user chooses? When you're in a lecture it is very easy to fumble up when having to go through the steps to add new page every time.

I love this app!  THIS app alone is the reason I have stopped looking for the "right" tablet. This app and note 10.1 are the perfect writing tool for meetings. Ive had just about everything else and own about every writing app.  Now, if this only synched up to a cloud account for sharing among my devices or viewing elsewhere it would be PERFECT,

I have yet to use the program but the amount of times it has updated makes me nervous about the developers.  Adding pages is difficult.  I would not recommend trying to learn to use this app and using it at the same time.  Your professor will look at you funny.  Also it updated twice this week.  The app works well once you figure it out, but it updates way too often for my comfort level.
That's superlame. Adding pages upon scroll would make this app usable.

I must admit having used various sketch apps on both ipad and android, this is without a doubt THE fastest! I detected no lag time when writing fast notes or sketching up drawings! I ALMOST overlooked it because the app icon for it looked tacky & cheap, so I assumed it was a cheap app, but I was wrong! So a suggestion to the developer, make the app nicer looking and please develop a business version of this app! :D
there is nothing else like it in the world! I use this app for school and my favorite function is the Cut and paste from another app.

I have downloaded  Pen supermacy Quill Tabnotes and I have to say this application is so much better than all of them.  First of all, you can import the pdf files into your notebook and read and annotate it ... Secondly, you could easily integrate your notes with evernote, dropbox  Thirdly, you can set the application only to be sensitive to the pen so your hand will not trace any mark on the note.  This is simply the best note taking software for people who want to use their android tablet for day to day school or professional note taking.
Way better than SNote, Papyrus, Memo. Clear winner.
I am using bamboo stylus and the results are good very similar to writing on paper
By far the best app for my Galaxy Note 10.1.

It's like Asus supernote with way better customization. I would rate it honestly 4.5 only because I don't see support for multiple devices to be in sync like my tablet and my phone. It's great though!

The new text tool is still not ready for use.  Once you choose to underline something, you cannot turn underlining off (except one word at a time after you type each word).  Also, it is way too difficult and cumbersome to adjust font size.
A highlighter function would be amazing
Use it for teaching my classes. Students respond very well to it. Great response from developer. Would recommend a feature to protect folders from accidental deletions.

Love the app. Are there any plans for Google drive integration without zipping the files? One thing I would love to see is the ability to open multiple notebooks within a folder. I like to import my homework and do my homework on sheets that i append in. But while doing my homework I like to refer to my notes. It would be awesome if you could switch between notebooks within a folder for easy reference, kind of like how you can go between sheets like in excel. Just an idea. This is the best app on my tablet and keep those updates coming.
Would give more stars if I could increase the line spacing.
Awesome app, great dev. Please add the option to reorganize the custom pencils and auto-save on a user defined timeout.
when I import a pdf file it looses the clarity as I zoom in.

I have an ASUS tablet.  I used the lite version for a couple days and liked it so well that I bought the full version. Best app I have purchased. I am very impressed that the author updates so frequently with customer suggestions.  I would like to see better integration with google drive. Also allow for better placement of the txt input layer. Instead of always being anchored in the upper left corner, it would be nice to start a text in any custom position on the page.  Thank you for such a useful app.

This app has literally changed my entire college experience and many other aspects of my life. I don't think I have a single other app on my tablet which is updated as frequently with new features and fixes - and that includes apps from powerhouses like Google. This app is worth at least 4 times more than he charges. Great work.
Awesome app, extremely useful! Love the functionality, teachers even appreciate it! Recommend it to every student! Amazing developer!!!!! Helps so much!!!
Great app, developer is also very helpful and updates frequently

I've used pretty much all of the note taking apps and this has by far the best combination of features, speed and configurability. The dev is very responsive to feature requests. I've run out of things to ask for and I'm fairly picky. Definitely worth paying for.
Excellent notebook app! A must for anyone after a digital paper alternative. Developer to be commended for being on top of things by providing enhancements regularly. Well done!
I searched and bought for many notebook apps and have found that this is the most most comprehensive and featured digital notebook and has continuous progress and development. ☆☆☆☆☆
See title

This app is the best out there for note taking.. But my small suggestion would be to make this app integrated with Dropbox so that we can easily store and view our files anywhere anytime :) .. If this feature comes, I 'll be donating for sure !! :D
Excellent note-taking app!

I've been using this for taking notes at my university, both in math and computer science courses, and it works just great! I was missing a few features, but contacted the developer and a couple of days later he had added them to the app! In other words, this is the perfect app for taking real notes in class. Forget about the old paper and pen! And the developer is the most responsive one you could ever wish for:-) Buy yourself a stylus and try this in school yourself, it's awesome:-)
Get this app, perfect for note-taking in lessons or similar. Amazingly good and the developer keeps making it even better, like even even better! Way better than Samsung's S-Note
Amazing App.
Best notetaking app

Dev is super responsive and all my suggestions implemented in weeks. Also the only note taking application that does what I need. Useful both casual, academic and professional use. Would buy again if I could to support developer.
Have used the trial version for a few days, and really like it. So, I just purchased the app to support the developer.  Keep up with the good work.  Thanks.

Great use of active stylus and buttons.  Smooth performance on a galaxy note 10.1.  Very responsive developer.  Custom settings can be a bit overwhelming in number, but I would rather have the control over the app's behavior than not.  S-Note has some better features (like images embedded as objects which can be sized and moved) but overall, this app is more stable (haven't had a crash yet, which. I can't say for S-Note).

I love this app. It's great for taking notes and I recommend this to anyone who needs to take handwritten notes on their Android tablet. The only reason it doesn't get five stars is because the app stores all your notes as images as opposed to vector graphics. When you zoom in they get nice and pixelated. I had an app on my iPad that seemed to store its notes as vectors and it really helped when writing close up.

This is an awesome app that makes my life a lot easier! I don't use notebooks anymore because all the notebooks I need are right here in this app. Don't hesitate to buy it, it's well worth the money! Plus, the developer is very kind and answers all the questions and suggestions very quickly. All in all, this is excellent!  EDIT: this just keeps getting better and better! Thank you so much developer for adding the text layer! Now this app is all I need for college!
I take notes at work and it is really nice to be able to scribble stuff amongst my notes.

This app is excellent.  I work as a management consultant and like to keep a notebook for each of my client projects, but have a habit of losing them. and it gets really heavy to carry 5 or 6 around.  This programme is the ultimate solution! Love the ability to switch between freehand and typing, and the PDF import and export functions are amazing! Have tried lots of note programmes but this is the first one that has made me give up paper.

Spend a few minutes reading the help page to get familiar with how things work, then customize it to your liking, and get writing!  Extremely customizable, with lots of options.  About the only thing I wish it did was SVG, versus bitmap file types.  SVG would allow further markup in something like AI or other vector based graphics app.
I love this app but it would be better if i could use my keyboard for when i am in lectures. The stylus does not work for me because it writes too big!!

I don't know if this does it, I haven't been able to figure it out if it does. Let me know or make it an option. Even though the writing is legible it would be nice to condense the writing into one clean page.

I use LectureNotes for it's original purpose: lecture notes and homework sets. I'm a physics graduate student and I prefer hand written notes for writing notes that include math and diagrams. LectureNotes allows me to take these notes without the hassle of a bunch of notebooks or papers to keep track of. I can be reading a physics book and decide to work out one of the exercises. Rather than getting up to get paper I just work it out on my tablet, and have it there forever. Moreover, after installing PDFView, LectureNotes opens pdfs (actually converts it - taking a little bit of time per page) and I can take notes right on the pdf, with the option to turn off different layers of notes at different times. For writing solutions to homework sets I don't have to type it all up - I can simply hand write it in the style that is most natural for me and then export to pdf to send to others. Search functionality, uses pen buttons, scrolling with finger, write with pen only, and many more options. Be sure to go through the settings yourself (as well as the about and help pages).

I have been looking for a note taking app for college and found this one. It works wonderful but it would be nice if i could split the screen with it so that I can take notes and do research online at the same time or at least have anothef app open at the same time. Other than that though it is a great app.

I used to use Notability for iPad 3 but eventually decided to switch to an Asus TF700T and tried to look for an app just like Notability for Android. I eventually found it in this app. It might not be as user friendly due to the customization options, but once you get around that it is definitely the best note taking app for Android feature wise.  Very good support also. I emailed a question and got a response that same day.

*** update *** I now have the note 10.1 and this app works brilliantly with it. I use this app everyday. I have replaced all my paper note pads /books and soley use this app. The developer is awesome.  Suggested app enhancement and within days it was done. Love it keep up the excellent work. **************************************************** I use this app with my HTC jetstream and works a treat. Would like to know how the galaxy notes stylus works with it.  Thinking of getting one for Uni

This app works really well. Once you know where everything is and what it does (which doesn't take long) then it is really easy to use. I emailed asking about custom paper patterns, and received a reply within 15 minutes! Also solved the problem in one. Overall, a very nice app and great customer support.

This is presently the best writing app in the market. I have used it extensively to write notes or draw diagrams in my samsung galaxy note 10.1".   In terms of user-friendliness, I consider it better than the S-Note that comes with the galaxy note.  Lee

One thing worth noting is that with pdf files you must first convert it to an image file within the program, so a supplementary pdf viewer such as ezpdf is still needed to open and search through pdfs. I wouldn't be surprised if they added an update to make it a functional pdf viewer in the near future because that's my only complaint.

PDF books take a REALLY long time to import. While importing the application often crashes or the Lenovo tablet freezes and needs to be restarted. Adding a page to the PDF textbooks makes the application crash. I cannot believe this product costs money!

I have been using this app on my HTC flyer for a long time, and I can say with certainty that it is  the best note-taking app I have tried.
