Love it!

I used this when I had a Galaxy Note 10.1 and I have yet to find anything equivalent. I now own a Samsung Ativ that runs Windows 8 and use Onenote in the place of this app and I am really not liking Onenote at all. The big advantage that this app has over Onenote is the ability to control what input is recognized. In this app I tell it to recognize only the stylus input so it minimizes the annoying things that happen when resting my palm on the surface of my tablet. Can't do that in Onenote and as a result you will have the most annoying time trying to ink.   If the devs are listening PLEASE make this available on Windows RT or Windows in general. The demand is there!
I wish you could email multiple pages at one time. Other than that I have had a great experience. Well worth the money.

This app is awesome! Im using a Galaxy Note 10.1, and I find this much better than S note for creating notes at work. I love how many options for customization there are! The pdf import option is great as well. Another bonus is that if you sync with Evernote, you can actually view your notes on almost any device. Unlike with the S note app where it creates a .snb file that is not very compatible. It would be great to have vector based drawings, but I dont know if that would slow rendering. Overall an awesome app that gets updated constantly. Awesome job and thumbs up to the developers. Keep up the good work!

Buying this app will increase the value of your tablet. It is extremely customizable and reliable.  This app has not crashed on me ever since I have been using it. Also, exporting and backing up notebooks has never been easier and efficient for me.

Seriously...If all I could do with my galaxy note 10.1 was use Lecturenotes...I would be very happy. The Galaxy note10.1 and this program are a match made in heaven. I have been waiting years for this. Keep up the great work.

The application has an amazing amount of customizability and an impressive array of features. Just when I was figuring out that there was no way to import pdfs (a major downside as a student) they add the feature perfectly. Great job devs and I look forward to seeing what else you come up with! 01/12/2012  Continues to be the best note taking app on the market! Absolutely love the recently added input zone feature. Now it works almost like the iPhone lecture apps. Keep up the good work!!

In my earlier review of this app, I recommended Antipaper Notes over this because Antipaper had a superior zoom mode. However, as of December 1, 2012, the dev has added support for a zoomed input area that takes up a configurable bottom fraction of the screen while showing the full page on the top fraction. With this, Lecture Notes has become the most full-featured note taking app on any OS, superseded only by Microsoft OneNote on a digitizer enabled device. Once you dive into the settings, you will begin to be amazed by how completely configurable it is. You can do almost everything, and the things you can't do are only things that you can't do yet.   Developer support is top notch, and if you have a feature request, he will respond to it within a day, and chances are he will listen to your suggestion or tell you that the feature has already been implemented! I've already emailed him three times in a month of using this app, and each time he told me that my feature request was already a feature, except for the zoom mode which he implemented within a month. Amazing developer, amazing app.

I have been looking for an app equivalent to onenote desktop version for my school work and this app is as close as it can get. Highly recommend it.  Thank you! thank you! thank you! for adding the zoom mode input.  Awesome app I would give you 6/5

Everything I've been looking for in a note taking app and more, easily the most customisable of all the note taking apps. just need to take time to tweak it to ur liking. One suggestion, enable assigning a customisable function to the volume buttons; like switching between pen and hand options.

I haven't tried this in class yet, but I have to say that it is like antipaper.. but offers more customizability and ease of use. I especially like the zooming and eraser more than antipaper. Very awesome.  UPDATE: I've been using this on my Galaxy Note 10.1 in class to take notes. This is so much better than the other things I've used.

the good: the notebooks interface is really good, especially the organization.  i love how you can import photos really easily. the bad: its slow at rendering and the pinch to zoom and two finger drag need improvement,  and the uploading photos isn't exactly fast.  the interface could be a little more accessible for tablets like bigger buttons and more of them.  the only way to import pics is through the camera, so pdfs are not really supported.  oh, and you can only type one line of text at a time, which isn't really convenient for classes that require a lot of that.  but it does export to evernote and gmail easily (it takes up good size of sace on evernote.)  it's good for things like math and bio though, and i'm glad i got it. i just wish they would update it already

I use a Nexus 7. I've purchased the full version and although it has potential this app needs more work. It's just not as user friendly as it could be. Extremely comprehensive note taking and PDF annotating app. Best out there that I have used and I've tried a decent number. I would recommend going through the help section as this app has a ton of features. All of which are well implemented and useful

My only requests would be maybe to have a floating hide action bar button option to quickly hide/unhide the action bar. Also the ability to import pictures to use as notebook/folder covers would be great to better distinguish between notebooks. E.g. leather texture/picture for diary, spiral notebook for class, etc.

This was a really nice app but I don't have a phone, I have this on my laptop so I can't touch the screen and write easily. I have to use the mouse pad and it's really uncomfortable. Can you please make it so that I can TYPE my notes as well? Thank you. :)
I can't believe how often a new version comes through with changes done "at user's request". This is inspiring.

Nothing comes close. I am an engineering student and many of my teachers project pdf's to annotate during lectures, and I can import the pdf's and go right along with them. It's a must have for any college student.

I use this app for college and it's great.  Alot of features to customize, so spend some time learning all the options available to you. For those that cannot find how to type text in a page, go to settings->menu and uncheck the hide drawing tools icon. Go back to a notebook and find the drawing tools icon (looks like a drawing compass) on the icon bar. There is a text option in the that menu. Its not as great as other text inputs in other apps, but hopefully the developers will add a better one. =]
Great App!

Very excited about the potential of this app, cant wait to add more stars. Needs what reviewers have mentioned, pressure sensitivity with the new S-Pen 2.2 SDK recently releases. Also needs the writing to sync with recording instead of just scrolling.  Other devices will naturally be taken care of if this app is tailored to what it has its true, maximum potential with, which is the galaxy S-Pen.

This is an excellent tool. When compared to The s-note, the snote  has great complex features but this is a simpler note pad that works great for any student. Its tap and go.  You can make custom pencils such as highlighter . If you have ebooks you can insert an image, such as a screen shot of your problem  and work it out directly on the note pad. It would be a bonus if multi tasking was enabled. But other than that very solid app and love the constant improvements .

There should be an"add' button On the bottom of the screen.Its Such a hassle to add a new Page on a notebook. You have to go to notebook overview than Spam the plus sign to add the Pages. other than that its all Good. A++
Fantastic writing app for the htc flyer!

What's needed is the ability to convert handwritten notes at a later time. ( aka "S Memo" feature - Handwriting to text).  This should be a basic requirement in all worthwhile handwritten note-taking apps.  Not sure why this is not implemented... but would definitely give 5 stars when it is.
It.s the best for gnote 10.1
I use it every day in class on an infinity pad. Great developer too.
Nice. Real time updates. Simple yet powerful.
This by far is my favorite note taking app. I'm currently using it to take notes for classes and works great!
Best note taking app hands down!
For an awesome developer that listens to every customer feedback, and for this awesome app.
the developer is very responsive! this app deserves the 5 stars :)
Use it daily

I refrained from purchasing this app as I really needed a better way of inputting text than that provided on this app. This issue has not been resolved yet but I have purchased anyway, why you may ask. Developers like Acadoid need to be encouraged, they bend over backwards  improving the app to meet customers expectations. This app is what it is today because of developer/user relationship. Love the app, please improve text input, need it badly!

This has made my college life sooooo much more organized! I keep all of my docs and notes in one place. It is so easy to use compared to many other tools. This is fabulous!  Is it wishful thinking to hope for an ability to convert to text someday?
Amazing... really happy. (Mega super when using with note 10.1 Tab)
I have been using this app for about a semester now, and it is absolutely amazing.  The ability to export to grace note and email my notes makes it so that I always have my class notes on hand.
Since I got my Galaxy note 10.1, I have been searching for the best note taking app. I tried them all, and this is by far the best.  I recommend without any reservation.

I emailed the developer and he sent out an update with my request within 12 hours! Amazing customer service.  I tried out several other note taking apps, and this one is definitely the winner. I'm cheap, but I was happy to pay for the full version. Using it on Galaxy Note 10.1 and it's really quite lovely. Palm rejection is perfect.  Developer is quick to answer emails.  Learned of an ability that's built in that is super handy: you can lasso erase. I was doing it line by line. Dee dee dee.
This is really a great app and the developer consistently enhance the product. Now it has completely replaced pen and paper for my work!
This is the best not taking app. Works great with my galaxy note 10.1. Goodbye paper!

Best of the best for gn10.1
Much, much better than S note. Only thing I'd recommend to developer is to add a better folder explorer.

I found resizing text wonky, as the resize tool did not let me resize as small as I want (the sizes of the resize and check boxes seem to impede smaller resizing).. And I'd like to go back and edit text. Better yet, typing directly onto any location On the page Would make this the best app.

This is the best note taking app I've tried. Although I bought this, I'm still torn between s note and this, but this is not the developer's fault. Comming from a HTC Flyer now my Note 10.1 is my daily note book in all meetings and for different customer projects. This app has the best writing experience of the ones I tested. Two things I'm missing: 1. A possibility to deactivate the auto screen brightness setting during usage. Right hand writers cover the sensor during writing 2. A real sync with Evernote. Means every page or notebook synced directly in the background to Evernote as a directly readable Evernote entry. (worked perfect on the Flyer)  Apart from that, great app many thanks.
Great app! Keep the good work

I've tried every note taking app and PDF annotater, but this one beats then all.  It has the most tools, settings, and versatility by far.  The creator is active and receptive to feedback.  The biggest highlight for me is the PDF integration.  I export PowerPoints as PDFs, then import them here and take notes directly on them.  Great for classes!
I have looked high and lo for a notetaking app that does it all and that's where lecture notes comes in I even downloaded the lecture recording wonderful product!!
Thank you~

Compared to note taker HD on my ipad this app isnt a very nice; in note taker HD, my notes look great; in this app my handwriting is way too big and the eraser is fairly silly since it's based on  delete by scribbling. At this point, I think I'm going to stay with my iPad when I need to take notes. The best part of doing this review, was using the voice input on my Nexus 7. Perhaps in the future, there will be a better note taking app on the Android platform.
Great app, using it to take notes in all of my aerospace engineering classes.  Not a fancy cumbersome program, just to the point.
really good app, works great with dagi stylus, the palm rejection is a great feature it should come as standard for all note taking apps! Well worth the money!

I had a need for a wide variety of uses for an app like this.. handwritten notes that could be moved around (i think better when I'm handwriting sometimes), the ability to insert images and write/draw over them, the ability to type text as well (my handwriting resembles silly string), and the ability to draw/write erds, diagrams, models, etc (annotated blocks with connections, basically).  I found one or two other apps with similar functionality, but none as simple. The free trial is great too.

I recommend using this with a stylus. Get one on Amazon for 85 cents. I attend a University and this app has replaced my paper notebooks. It takes some time to become familiar with this, but once you know how to use this killer app, the people sitting next to you in class will be jealous. Seriously, the person next to me tried to steal my Nexus 7. What a jerk.
What a cool dev, the apps feature set is growing like wildfire based on user input!

Take the time to set it up. Works great on my Galaxy Note. Just wish it had font size options for the text settings within the note. They could be a little smaller, right now you can only get the text as small as the the four little control boxes allow, basically when they touch.
Very good app. Very good support. The best hand writing app!
I am a teacher and this app is a god send. Thanks sooo much

Great app! Best I've found for general note taking or basic drawing. Very configurable and if you can think of it, the app can probably do it. Can import and export and share in numerous ways. Highly recommended!

Awesome app!! Works amazingly for all my classes...very easy to use!!!	I love all of the capabilities of this app. It makes the life of a college student so much simpler and organized!!!  I like that I can record a lecture and take notes simultaneously. I just wish it could allow editing of notes as you are reviewing the audio recording. (Maybe in future versions hopefully)... works beautifully on galaxy note 10.1!!
By far the best app out there for students looking to get the most out of an active digitizer.  I use this baby every day in class and its saved me pounds of weight and tons of paper!

Hands down the best note taking app on the market. Just wish it could annotate pdfs like Ezpdf , cos the annotation here is much superior than the ezpdf. Thanks to the dev, you have my full support. Keep up the good work

Update: the developer added an append Page icon as requested. This type of dedication to user input is very much appreciated. It's a gripe but one I've come to rely on using the galaxy note. Also s pen compatibility would be great. :)

This is really nice app for writing notes. I have been taking notes with it for a few days and becomes easier as you get used to it. I would recommend it for people who want to take handwritten notes.   However there are places where it can be improved. For example, feature to combine different notes into one would be nice.

After trying many note taking apps I came across this gem,and even tho the trial was enough for me I still bought the full version because its mint its got everything. even a theme option for amoled users (battery saver) Developers responsive and helpfull, I doubt you will find better than this especially for a Galaxy Note, buy the app support the dev and enjoy :)
Good ap great developer resposiveness

Really like this app, it works great. The palm heuristics are great!  I wish PDFs could be imported multiple pages at a time. Its quite tedious to import more than a few pages of lecture notes.  I would gladly sacrifice the ability to resize the pdf.

Very useful.

I love this app use it all the time for uni though there are 2 thing missing one would be to import pdfs so u could write on them for lecture notes, the other way is a easier way of entering text and adding new pages. But overall this is a must have app for students

This app makes pen and paper obsolete.  It takes a little effort to get it configured exactly as you like it, but it's a great app from the start.  The configuration is an evolutionary process by which you only fall in love with it yet more.

I have tried countless notetaking apps on my HTC Jetstream and this one is, by far, the best. Works with pressure sensitive digital pen, quick stylus response (no lag like other apps), nested folders and notebooks, evernote and social media support, great palm rejection, and amazingly customizable. Worth the few bucks I spent on it. Can't wait to see what this app becomes as new updates and features are released. Stellar as is, though.
Worth every penny!

This app is very useful. I don't regret buy this app at all. I am really hope that the dev can add recorder function just like the notes stock app on HTC flyer. Really happy with this app, I don't use pen and paper at work anymore... Plenty of options to import stuff into notebooks, custom pencils, and a very responsive developer by the looks of it.
Great notetaking app with many useful features and modifications.  Developer is readily available and very very helpful. Keep it up!!!!!
I don't like the way it writes with the stylus, it's nothing like pen to paper. It does what it is intended for, but not worth the cost.

This is my first app review I have been searching for a stylus note taking app for my Nexus 7 and I tried writepad, freenote, quill and handrite.  By far, this app was the clear winner with the following features. Customisable auto-forward, custom zoom, pdf export/import, folder organisation, direct export to Evernote in pdf, palm rejection. I use this app for my meetings and classes. The developer was very responsive too. Look forward to future releases. Only wish the platform was in vector rather than bitmap.
Works flawlessly as a note taking/handwriting app, the developer is responsive to requests. I've tried several apps of this type and this one is the best.
This app is my daily driver for note taking at work.  Works very well with Jot stylus on the Nexus 7.  Keep the updates/improvements coming!
How about a 'reminder' or Alan function on a particular note? Great app!

The undo function has limited number of 'undos' which seems to a  depend on what you've done. It really needs to keep track of objects (like text) better so that you can select and highlight or alter them after placement. Objects should have opacity that you can alter when placing them. Personally don't like the way the erase works, but each to their own. Would be good to have cut/copy/paste functionality, rather than the cut/move functionality that is there presently. Would be nice to be able to set arbitrary line and grid widths and confine them to regions of the paper, including having different such features in different regions (eg a grid on one side of an image and lines on the other) Would be a super app if you could select a region for hand writing recognition. But it is a simple drawing app targetting lecture note taking. Does that OK. PDF import is good (but would be super if it allowed you to modify pdf contents rather than just have the page as an image)
Purchased the full version to support the developer, and as even the free version works fantastically. Works exactly as you would expect it to, and maybe even better. Keep up the awesome work.
Thoughtful choice of features and works as promised. The icing on the cake would be if the developers included an option to save the pages as vector images instead of raster images.
Tried many handwriting  apps for Lenovo  think pad , but this  is  only one that works perfectly. Excellent job developers. Thanks.

This app is the best note taking app I have used on my think pad tablet.  Although I was wavering between quill and this app, lecture notes, I have steadily been persuaded that this is the best app by the dozen or so features that have been added "upon user request" in the past couple of months.  Although just barely missing a couple key big features, this app has all the little things down pat, I feel like I am writing on paper with this app, and I love using blackboard mode.  The customisable toolbar, and almost exhaustive settings mean that this app runs the way I want it.  And a huge feature for me just added this past week is the ability to import whole PDF files into the notebook ( this is something at least three major note app developers were asked to do, and nearly a year this is the only dev to fulfill the request).  Thus in conclusion this app is the best, not because it has everything, but because at this rate of development it will have everything you want, and if it doesn't it will have it soon.
Well done! Export to pdf with document background is amazing. Support for typing and the galaxy note would be excellent.
Superior, must have app!
I usually don't comment but this app is phenomenal for my lectures in college. Dev can you please add a typing option as well? Also a sound recorder would be great,!
This developer has almost perfected the irritating palm hovering/touching/activating. Well done on a job well done.

I was looking for an app that resembles natobility for ipad (gasp) . Lecture notes is as good if not better and is the best note taking app for Droid.  The features are all there from import / exporting photos in your notes and converting notes to PDF later. I wish I knee about this app before I bought antipaper and writepad
Best android app and most used.
Great app for taking notes for college, meeting, etc. Wish it had a typing option too!! It would be sooo much more helpful!
by far the best app for stylus tasks

I use this app with my htc flyer to take and organize handwritten notes.  I have tried pretty much every other note app out there, and this is the best for use with the flyer's active digitizer pen. It allows you to turn off touch input while writing, so that the 'palm-rejection' functions perfectly.  Also, the scrolling option automatically adds new pages, giving the effect of 'infinite paper'.  I also have not found another app that allows nesting of notebooks the way this app does.
Great companion to the Lenovo stylus.
Best Best Best app for my thinkpad tablet. It eliminate all limit my need. It better if can manage or use cross platform (window, apple, window phone)

Tried few version of writing pads. So far this is the best. Can really write on it. Some also can write, but not to the extend u can freely choose or set your colour pen, better zooming. Others are fake, u can't write, have to use keyboard althought it said "writing note pad"!!!!  This apps offers me unlimited writing pages n able to customise my own colour pen. No complains. I will give u the final star only if u can give me choose different types of paper(plain paper is too boring!) and with different backgrounds and other special features, i.e icons, better toolbar layout, add attachment, sounds, have ms powerpoint playback feature, recognise words and read aloud function etc.  Hope to see more improvement.  Lastly, this apps add a purposeful value for all users buying a tablet!!!!

Best note taking app I've used. Great stylus use,pen smoothing, and finger navigation. Good 2 way sharing options.  How about timestamped voice recordings to compliment the notes?   Also option to paste in web links from browser sharing.
Great app, love that folders can be nested. Updated frequently! Keep up the great work!

Completely replaced my notebooks. Does exactly what it needs. Easy of zooming and scrolling makes it possible to use a insensitive capacitative touchscreen well. Love the save zone option for palm rejection. Just very well thought out and useful app. HP Touchpad w/ICS.

It has everything a real notes app needs & more, plus an incredibly responsive dev.  If it were vector it would be perfect, but then it couldn't do what it does. Very intuitive to navigate. **Galaxy Note S-pen** isn't as accurate as n-trig, but it isn't as accurate anywhere, but it **works.**
Best note taking app

don't be mislead by its name, it is not only for note-taking, you can use it for drawing as well, given its many features, it may be actually one of the best on android. especially good with a pressure sensitive stylus. and it is constantly improved as well.
Amazing app. However I would like to suggest adding smaller steps when rotating cuts. This way one can make for example a diamond by rotating a square.
best
The settings sold me on this. Specially the offset option that takes negative numbers. Have changed background to black and using a white pencil. Love it.

This app brings full functionality of TPT as note-taking device. Definitely 5 stars!!! And thanks for the forward and backward button.  Update: This app is just amazing. I just realized that by using dropsync, i can flawlessly sync all of my notes in my TPT and galaxy notes, vice versa! Awesome!!!

I would love to see a keyboard option because i type faster than i write and the sensitivity on my galaxy tab doesnt seem to be as good as some other tablets out there. But don't get me wrong about the fact that i was looking for a handwriting notebook app because i tend to scribble notes between my notes and draw diagrams. Thanks!

It is quite a good app. However, the app should have an option to add paper margin initially like Quill.   Moreover, the app should have option to have keyboad input. Sometimes, handwriting is not always good for notetaking.
Looked a long time for am app like this. Wonderful.
This is a great app love it

If you are a ThinkPad Tablet owner them you are less than pleased with the onboard note taking app that it comes installed with.  LectureNotes is an app that should come with the device, it works so well! I'm a computer engineering student and easily needed a portable device that could keep up with my hectic schedule and remain productive throughout the processes. Before stumbling upon this app I must admit that I was a bit concerned with my investment. If you have a ThinkPad Tablet... get this app.

I have only one problem on Galaxy Note CyanogenMod9. When writing with S-pen in hardware stylus only mode, any touch with the palm will interrupt and delete the gesture. Can you fix this? Might be xaused by the rom. Otherwise perfect.

There is little more that I can add to previous reviews, but I will have my say ;-)  This is by far the best note-taking application on Android and among the best across all operating systems. As an engineering student, I find the many features fantastic and helpful. For those who just want an app to work from the start, this one does. However, spending time with the settings and options, you can really take full advantage of this app. I recommend it for anyone who needs to make notes, not just students. The developer could not be more helpful and responsive. Using this app really is a pleasure.

The most flexible , responsive drawing / sketching app for the Lenovo Thinkpad tablet . The developer is super responsive and thats a very big plus point . Very few developers give this level of after sales service for an app .

I am so impressed with this app! It is extremely feature rich and user friendly. The developer is incredibly responsive, the most I've ever seen (I was at least one of those who suggested keyword export). There is also a phenominal help page that really guides the use of the app. To be more specific: I like the ability to have both individual folder and notebooks and to be able to pin them to the Home screen. There is also so much fine tuning one can do such as custom pens and paper size and background.

This app is the absolute best for note-taking. Haven tried Quill, Antipaper, Writepad, PhatPad, and many others, this app is head and shoulders above all else. Writing is quick and easy. The app is great with the cut/paste functionality, adding/deleting pages, lass-erase, quick writing and coloring toolbar, and adding basic shapes. Everything I have thought "it would be awesome if this app has (insert suggestion)," I find that the app already has, plus more. This has seriously changed the way I take notes on my lenovo thinkpad, and I am very grateful for a wonderful developer that has created a top-notch product. If you aren't sure, try out the Trial Version, and you will end up buying this!
Tested them all, this is the best. Extra points on the dev who seems really active and responsive!

LectureNotes works great, there is a lot of control over nearly every aspect of the program so it may take a little fiddleing to get things set up to be most efficient for you.  I left the iPad becasue I could not use it to take notes in class, you must have an active stylus to make it worthwhile.  This app does that job extremely well, part of the process of learning for many people is writting notes, not typing, not handwriting recognition; the process of writing.  When that process is changed too much, from the way you learned to write, then it interferes with the learning process, this app does not get in the way, it lets you write and keep on writing.  Export to PDF and then review on your PC or move your notes into DropBox and carry them with you.
If you have a tablet with stylus it is a must have app.  It works awesome on my Lenovo Thinkpad

I rarely write a review. But this one deserve a special recognition. Of all that I tried, this is the most responsive. Also, it recognize even a small letter that I write. And also comes with a feature to export to pdf. Keep up the great work guys!

I have tried dozens free/paid app and this is by far THE best app for taking notes. There are tons of costumizations. And the programmer updates frequently with user requests options. This app is worth every penny.

My app of choice for handwritten notes. I think it is the best one out there in the market. Keep the good work. Maybe, a floating menu will be very useful.

Have trie many note taking apps for my Flyer, this one is excellent.

Awesome app, used it on both a Lenovo ThinkPad tablet and a HTC flyer, it looks a tiny bit funky on the flyer (seems a little out of scale) but otherwise an outstanding effort. A bit of polish ( a.k.a animations, nicer interface and the ability to better customise notebook covers ala Microsoft Courier / iOS's paper) will go a long, long way.  Fantastic work!   Oh would it be at all possible to include some nice painting tools to this app too? I'd love to see this compete withthe iOS app "Paper by 53"
Tried many, best one yet! Please keep up the good work and keep on adding features. Fast, responsive and very accurate. Could use import and highlight tools ( markers).
Well worth the money! Hopefully handwriting recognition along with bookmarks will implemented :) but still best app
This app is the best note taking app. I like it more than anything Eli in the iPad or Android marketplace.  If you have an HTC tablet this is the first app you should have.

I tried several note-taking aps for my Lenova Thinkpad tablet, and this one is by far the best. Fluid writing, lots of features, easy to edit/erase, and able to export to .pdf. I used to use Windows Journal to prepare/give (math) lectures for years on a tablet-notebook PC, and was hoping to get the same functionality out of my new tablet... This is the ap that is making it possible. It has every feature I used on Windows Journal.  I love that you can bring up a menu of 12 fixed and 12 user-defined pens/highlighters, making it 1-click to switch colors, width, etc. In many aps, switching colors or width takes a few clicks, which can slow youn down a lot, esp. in a lecture. Not here. And if the menu is in the way, you can hide it, though I never do (it is small and moveable). I was also surprised to find that, after importing .png's of notes from other aps, they were editable.  It has zoom, straight line/rectangle/circle drawing, huge control over colors and line style, the wrist-ignoring works great, the eraser is awesome (can circle large areas to erase the whole thing or small bits precisely, all without switching erasers, and its easy to see what you are erasing)...great ap!

As an engineering student I take notes by hand a lot. This app makes note taking simple and fluid. If you own a tablet with a stylus like the Lenovo thinkpad, this app is a must. I especially love how easy it is to annotate pdf's once they are imported into the app. This app makes your tablet worth its weight in gold.
This app has almost everything. The only things missing are line smoothing and a lasso tool for erasing. (Hint Hint, Developer)   That being said it has the best options of any hand writing app.
I recently switched from quil to this app due to the versatility of this app in taking meting notes such as the ability to import pictures. Great app overall.
This is by far the best app in terms of writing identification, but until it gets a zoom box (like Antipaper Notes) it's difficult to use.
This app is perfect for taking notes in class. The only improvement would be to have an audio record feature. But I love this app!

I've been looking for something like this for a while. Absolutely brilliant; I can take notes in the app, pictures on my phone, then import them once the lecture/lesson is over.  Now I use Drop box for backups, I am essentially going through uni paperless :) All I take is the Touchpad.  Highly recommended.
Makes marvels in my htc flyer with the stylus, easy and seamless work to send files

Just the developers commitment to the users of the app alone is worth the price.  Best note taking app I've used so far with my HTC Flyer.  Just look at the reviews and look at the history of updates accommodating the users...awesome!  An app that just keeps improving.  Thanks!

Purchased my Thinkpad Tablet October 2011 and have been obsessed with finding the right app for taking lecture notes. I tried and purchased all of the top contenders (Antipaper, Quill, Writepad, etc), but none of them come close to this app. It has everything the ther guys left out. Stylus only mode, stylus button as eraser, scrolling pages, crop-n-move notes inside a page, custom size the ruled lines of notebook on a page, and so much more.  This app is responsive, intuitive, well designed, tons of settings, and just a pleasure to use. No useless features like some of the others. I really feel bad bashing Antipaper and Quill... they were great... but, simply not as good as this app.   Congratulations to the developer! I'd be willing to pay more than double the price for this app given how great it is (yes, I'm probably going to anger folks with that comment but hopefully that gives the developer added reason to continue iterating this thing into perfection).
Glad that it allows for picture import. Please support htc flyer button. It'll be perfect.
And please make HTC Flyer stylus button working ;)

Finally, an app that can really be used as a paper replacement! This app is both feature rich and stable. Works very smoothly on the galaxy tab 10.1. I have tried all the note taking apps on the market, and this one is the best by a large margin. Well done! One feature which may be useful is a zoom window, in which you can write comfortably while being able to see the rest of the page outside the zoom window. This feature exists in Antipaper and in TabNotes.

I have a Lenovo Tablet, after using and purchasing such apps as PenSupremacy, Quill, TabNotes & Antipaper, I wish I had come across this one first and saved all my time.  Using the 'stylus' only setting I don't have to worry about where I am resting my palm!  It has great compression when saving as a pdf, easy to scroll between pages, got quite a few settings to personalize for individual tastes. Have had no issues, every thing works great
I use this for taking notes on my thinkpad tablet and it functions beautifully.

I had a long wish list for features in other note taking apps but this came along and already includes those features and they keep adding more. So far everything works great. Contrary to one of the prior reviews, I'm using a Lenovo Thinkpad tablet with Honeycomb and have no problems.

This application is simply stunning. I love the ability to write fluidly when thinking and this is the first app on Android that does that. I've used OneNote on Windows tablets for the last 7 years and this is at least as useful as that app, in fact due to the HTC Flyer that I use it on I think it's even better as I carry this thing with me everywhere.  The interface is simple but take time to read the help it is jam packed with great advice. I have created a set of pencils that are perfect for my liking including the softness of them. The import and export functions are very nice. If I was being greedy I would love to see a direct export to evernote but that extra 1 click is hardly tough.  To make this superb I would love to be able to add typed text to the screen as well. That makes it a different app though and it's so damned great as it is I would be loathe to change anything in it.  HUGE KUDOS to the Dev. You are a code wizard.

Compared to other handwriting apps this is the best and most versatile I have used. Cut-and-paste, layers and the ability to make a custom safezone where you can rest your hand on the screen are some of the features I would like to highlight! I use it together with a dagi stylus and the touchscreentune app on a samsung galaxy 10.1 and that combination makes it highly usable as apposed to handwriting on the stock galaxy : ( Great developer(s)  that makes frequent updates and complies to users wishes and ideas.  Recommendations from me!

I have tried at least half a dozen different note taking apps.  After resigning myself to the fact that there will never be an Android app such as Notes Plus or Penultimate on IOS, Lecture Notes is released and exceeds all of my expectations.  There seems to be an update nearly every day, making the app better with each release.  Tremendous job!

I am using this app on my thinkpad tablet, and thanks to Lecturenotes I can use the tablet on my work as a research associate to be now 100% paper free. It does anything I need, I feel the hand writing so natural, I can import images and make annotation, export the notebooks to pdfs, the index feature is just amazing, and the feedback with the developer is just increible. If a need a new feature that will help with my productivity, I just ask for it, and if it is possible, in a short time, there is an update on the application.  Everything is intuitive, and... well just to say that this app is just great.  I do not have any economic interest, I am just ultra happy with this app and how it helps to my productivity. Welcome back to the handwriting  in the computer era.    Thanks
I have tried several notes apps on my Jetstream, and this app easily tops them all. The developer himself is very helpful and responsive. Thanks for enabling the Ntring on my Jetstream!

I have searched far and wide for a note taking app that had everything I needed. This application is everything I needed and more. It allows me to take notes for all my college classes and indexes them so I can easily find and review them. It is the best on the market by far! I had a question and suggestion for the developer and he replied back the same day thanking me for the ideas and explained how it might be difficult to implement but definitely a good idea he hopes to incorporate (the idea of changing the layout of individual pages rather than the whole notebook itself). This application is easy to use, has great customization, and above all great customer service. The developer truly takes the users considerations and implements them.  Perfect App!
Great app for various usage.... Thx!
simply great. best I've seen so far. and the developer is so nice and attentive. frequently updated.

I HAVE TESTED ALMOST ALL OF THE HANDWRITING NOTE APPS ON THE MARKET, AND THIS ONE BY FAR IS THE VERY BEST - HANDS DOWN! IT FEELS AND LOOKS JUST AS NATURAL AS WRITING ON AN ACTUAL NOTEBOOK BUT IS SO MUCH BETTER BECAUSE IT HAS ALL OF THE VALUABLE TOOLS, FUNCTIONALITY AND GREAT FEATURES THAT YOU CAN'T HAVE ON PAPER, OR THAT I HAVE SEEN ON ANY OTHER APP YET. THE APP IS AMAZING AND PERFECT FOR ALL MY PROFESSIONAL & PERSONAL NEEDS! AN ABSOLUTE MUST HAVE FOR TABLET USERS ESPECIALLY.

I am a HTC jetstream user, and I have never seen a handwriting app like 'lecturenote'. I attached an antiglare film protector on my jetstream. With this app, I just feel like writing something on the surface of a paper note. The pen response is incredibly fast and I like some special features such as image importing, drawing tool box with shapes, and selective options.     One thing, when it comes to HTC jetstream which has the same N-trig feature as HTC Flyer, the "use stylus(hardware detection)" option can't be ticked. Could you solve this problem !? Thanks

I will forever be grateful to the developer(s)  for creating and continually improving this app. I concur with all of the positive comments from users below.  It is a joy to find that every description  provided by the developers are true.  I wholeheartedly recommend this app to anyone who is looking for a replacement for the old pen + paper + scanner combination; the conversion of handwritten notes to PDF is effortless and seamless.
Great for HTC Flyer

Ive tried them all and this one is by far the best.  5 stars would be perfect and its almost there.  Developer is quick to respond and make corrections.  With his constant attention, this will be perfect in no time!!!

The app itself is very, very good.  But what makes it is the developers.  Email them any idea you have and you will surely get a response and the addition of those features.  It keeps getting better and better.  Keep up the good work!

It's a great note taking application for android, but still need more feature before i give it 5 stars. Could you Please develop these ;  - the ability to insert a webpage content or image on the notes. - voice recording.because sometimes we dont want to miss something  - could you please develop a stylus only mode for other tablet (i'm using GTAB 10.1), and still hard to me to make a good notes regarding palm rejection.

I have tried several handwriting Android apps, and LectureNotes has the most features and options, and produces the smoothest writing experience of them all. (I am using it on an ASUS Transformer Prime tablet, running Android 4/Ice Cream Sandwich.)  LectureNotes does not experience as many "skips" in handwriting in smaller lateral movements as do some other apps. Particularly nice is the ability to zoom in and then write in that zoomed mode. It works well in either landscape or portrait modes.     Wide choice of pen features (3 standard and 12 custom), with a handy toolbox to select from. Can select/rope text and copy/move it. Can add multiple layers and edit/display/delete them. Can add keywords to pages, which then builds an index and Table of Contents. Flexibility in color of notebooks, color and size of pages, and paper patterns. Can import images, and export/share individual pages or whole notebooks in PNG, PDF, or ZIP, or share to other apps like Evernote.  Most impressive is the responsiveness and interaction of the developer on issues or ideas. Has quickly implemented wish list suggestions.  A top notch app with frequent enhancements!
Killer app for HTC Flyer devices!

I've tried all the Android handwriting apps and none compares to this. As its name implies, LectureNotes is a full fledged system for taking, organizing and storing handwritten notes. It is brilliantly implemented by a truly responsive developer who is rapidly incorporating user suggestions into this app. It isn't quite perfect, but it has come so far in two months of existence that I have little doubt that it is a winner. Buy it!

I'm a college student and have always used my hp tm2 touch smart tablet PC, I have now switched to asus transformer prime, at first, I was very unhappy with captive touch writing apps, I was spoiled by Microsoft office one note and my digitizer pen. lecture notes has changed that. hand writing is easy, strokes glide and when I'm done writing out taking notes I can actually read what I have written. the only option I miss is having the ability to print professor power points to my notes and writing on them. with that said, I contacted this developer to request this feature. this developer did up and beyond any that I have ever contacted. he/ she explained why the function I need was so hard to implement into this app, and he further pointed me to a way I could implement this feature for now, he further acknowledge the importance of this feature. you rock!  I will stick with your app and I will not hesitate to buy anything else because I know it will be great, and I will receive the best customer service. thank you
Great app...  Use it for work.  Gave developer a suggestion and they responded quickly replying that it's in their to do list.  I love that the backup copies are stored locally and not the cloud.

This is actually the best app out there with the best dev group. I've been sending emails massively to them talking about all the features I would like to see in this app, and they respectifully answered every email and made the improvements right after. Even if there is something not that perfect in this app, I will still be staying with it and sending all the ideas I came up with to make it better.  This never happened before between me and an app.

I was writing an app very much like this but the developer beat me to it! The app is great so far and is everything I needed for note taking. My only gripe is the responsiveness for my tablet, where it does take time to process the draw.  I recommend to anyone needing a note app!

Awesome app, best note app available on the market. I have tried all of them and this is the best I have tried so far.   The developer is really awesome, I sent him and email with a few questions and a feature request, and he replied immediately, and then added the feature I asked for the  very next day! Never have I been so impressed with an app dev.
This is a really great application. Very responsive to the stylus. But I have to say the updates and feature expansion is incredible. Show a great responsiveness to the needs of the user.
Great app great service. The best on the market, if there is a feature you want just ask and they add it

This is a great app. i'm a student in law school and finding ways to incorporate technology into my schooling def makes things easier. the only thing i don't like about it is that when the stylus lines up with your palm resting on the screen the stylus isn't recognized anymore.   i do have another suggestion for the developer to make it even better, but the email link on his/her site doesn't work, so if they read this if they could email me and i'll send the suggestions their way.
I  use this app to take my organic chem and physics notes. it is by far the best app out there for my Lenovo thinkpad tablet.

Using this software with a Lenovo thinkpad tablet for note taking because it manages to have everything I felt was lacking from both the stock note taking software, and quill, and even does that while being more responsive as well. I had a suggestion for the developer and received a response within hours, only to find that my suggestion had been implemented already, and that I had just missed it.

Brilliant App - works gr8 in Flyer; it has got all it needs to be one of the best ! Needs some additional features like password protection etc. Emailed the developer amazingly he replied which not many do ! I am told that the feature will be added in coming updates wow!  finally a developer who listens to the suggestions, Many thanks Markus - keep up the good work !

I'm a doc student and travel to evaluate intern teachers. I had the trial version and it worked beautifully. So I paid the big bucks and got the full version. I have a feeling i will use this in my classes as well. It is also exciting to see the developers interaction with users in the other reviews, making me feel comfortable that this app will continually improve.
Write
Brilliant, brilliant, brilliant! My paperless world gets ever closer.

I tried out the trial version of this app and was quite pleased with the performance on my HTC Flyer.  Purchased the full version and sent a message to the developer.  I asked about a "scroll with stylus" option, and a dedicated HTC Flyer "stylus only" option.  Not only did I get an immediate response, he said that he'll try to work the options into a later version.  This application literally improves daily.

01/12/12 update: the developer for this app is very responsive, he/ she fixed what I suggested within days. I hope this app will do well in the android market :)  original review: Great potential but could u please make the writing smoother and more responsive. also  could u make "dotting" possible (i could not do the dot on my i's and so on) if u could fix this 2 things this apps would become the best one out there.i just bought this and wont be returning it because I think it has great potential:)

I want to eliminate all the notebooks I carry and having to flip around to refer.  I tried using the default notes application and felt short of what I wanted.  This application was absolutely perfect to replace all my notes.  It is quite responsive to the stylus.  In landscape mode it is a stunner - jaws dropped when I did the 'whiteboarding' on my Lenovo.  The page is larger than the screen (and customizable) and can be configured (patterns or plain).  The developer of the app is very responsive to feedback and I can only see it getting better.  Great potential and hope to see more users.

I use this in business meetings running on my TPT and it works awesome. After meetings I export to PDF, and back up the PDF to my external SD for safe keeping.  Fantastic, I almost never use paper now. I have all my notes encrypted and secured. Not to mention the pdf files are searchable, were a stack of paper in a folder inst so much.  Dev constantly updates and is always rolling out fixes quickly for user request and issues. And this app dev doest ask for unnecessary permissions that the app doesn't need to operate like lots of apps on the market. If you have a think pad tablet. Buy this you won't regret it.
